Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, rooms and service.”
Reviews.Author: mick0214
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel for a week in March 2012 and from check in to check out we did not find 1 thing to fault in here. Reception staff were always nice & cheerful & helpful...well done.Check in & check out were fast and efficient. Stayed in room 205 which is facing the back of hotel, some views of mountains to north and very quiet room.Room had 2 double beds, flat screen tv, microwave, coffee maker, iron & ironing board, fridge,i-pod dock,ample supply of tea bags & coffee and plenty of wardrobe/drawer space for clothes.Bed linen changed on request just by leaving a card on bed. Bathroom was nice & clean , plenty of towels and hot water.. Just around corner from hotel on Denamn St you will find the Denman Mall which has a discount supermaket called "No Frills" (I think that was the name) where you can get all the basics for survival in your hotel room ie bread, butter, milk etc. Hotel is located across road from English Bay beach which leads into Stanley Park where you will always find people walking, cycling, rollerblading and just generally enjoying themselves. Hotel is on Davie St which is a nice stroll 1 mile eastwards to downtown. Just outside of hotel you can also get a bus to take you downtown. Plenty of bars,liquer stores,restaurants and fastfood outlets in general area of Hotel. Take a walk east on Davie St until you come to Granville St, turn right here and over bridge to Granville Island ,where after spending some time exploring the markets with their massive selection of mouthwatering foods, you can catch a ferry back towards English Bay beach. We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel while we were visiting our son in Vancouver and will definetly be staying here again when we return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: CDNPrairieGal
Reviews.Content: I love the location and stay here whenever in Vancouver. I cannot say enough about the wonderful service. Everyone was cheerful and enthusiastic. If I had an issue, they dealt with it efficiently and with a smile. I too had an issue with the construction. Some mornings it was an 8 a.m. start time, others, a 7:30 a.m. start time was more likely. I had no idea the law was 8, I would agree that guests should be alerted to this when booking. I would request a room at the back if you want to avoid the brunt of the noise. The view is not as great, but out the front door is the beach! The room doors could be more insulated as could the walls, but the staff were quick to move me when a very loud family with screaming, wall pounding children moved in next door to me. This is an amazing price for a hotel in this location. The rooms are clean, the restaurant has decent food-great breakfasts- and the service, as I said, was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel, English Bay location”
Reviews.Author: DodieKamloops_BC
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at the Sands 4 times, and it is one of my favorite places to stay. Love the location, the decor of the rooms are upscale, nice to have a balcony also robes & slippers a plus. My last stay was March 2nd, for 2 nights on a business trip. The front desk staff were great, housekeepers very friendly and accommodating, excellent breakfasts and good value. A safe area to walk on my own, I recommend the Sands for location,great property, lots of great restaurants, and the atmosphere..

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: traveltweet
Reviews.Content: I would have given this a 4.5 stars. Great location, reasonable price. The staff was very helpful. We had two rooms, both were upgraded to ocean view. The only issues were that the noise level was high (we were on the 3rd floor) since Davie st is a busy st and the bed could have been better (the mattress was too soft). We will come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, convenient ...”
Reviews.Author: kindablue
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent four nights here and were impressed, even though we foolishly accepted a room across from the ice machine. The room itself was pleasant and comfortable, well-maintained and odor-free, with a small refrigerator, decent coffee, a large flat-screen TV, robes and slippers, and free Wi-fi. The front desk personnel were accommodating, efficient, and friendly. They honored a deal we got online for free-parking (even though it was a mistake), and they were kind and patient. The location of the hotel is excellent, with the #5 Robson bus to downtown right there, and a diverse selection of ethnic restaurants within walking distance. And you're right on English Bay, at the entrance to Stanley Park, and in close proximity to the ferry that takes you to Granville Island. (The one drawback is that construction is going on nearby, so do ask to be as far away from that as possible. Fortunately they don't begin until 8 a.m. and stop at around 3:30 pm, and do not work on the weekends.)

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel at an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BrechinBay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in Vancouver with very friendly and quick service personel. It is dog friendly and very clean. The restaurant at the lobby has good food but the service is slooooowwwww! Even when the place is nearly empty, and there are 3-4 waiters around the service is still deadly slooooowwwwww!!!!! I like the location for strolling the English Bay beaches, to Stanley Park and visit the many-many food places on Denman street. This is the most "gay" area of the city of Vancouver so excpect to see many boy and girl couples in the cafes and bench parks. The area and the city is wonderfully (mostly) free of biggots and everyone minds their own. This is a great part of this great city and the hotel fits in nicely. It has good internet service, excellent security and lots of parking even though it costs about 12 extra dollars to park. The staff go out of their way to be helpful and even lend you an umbrella when it rains (often in the winter, but very mild weather) and give directions a plenty. The city buses to Robson Strasse (shop till you drop), Stanley Park and just about everywhere you want to go leave from outside the door of this hotel!! See you there.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade on their own”
Reviews.Author: Dalsoh
Reviews.Content: I reserved via "priceline.com" as two adults, the first time, Jan., I stayed twin queen with one of my colleagues, but, this time, they charged $15 per day. I cannot understand their policy.

Reviews.Title: “Pefectly acceptable, nothing special but nice”
Reviews.Author: RainingCatz
Reviews.Content: We stayed there this past weekend. The Room: I appreciated reading other reviews so we asked for a higher floor to avoid the traffice noise and that worked out well. Of course we heard noises from other rooms but they were minimal and nothing to contact the front desk about. The "mountain view" is really a view of downtown with some mountains in the distance. The "English Bay" view is really a view of a sliver of English Bay. One thing which was really puzzling was the queen-size mattress put on top of a full size box spring. I rolled right out of bed onto the floor because a full six inches of the side of the bed was unsupported by anything. The room was average. The bathroom was also average with the typical slow-draining tub. Ankle deep in water by the time I finished washing my hair. Adored the soft, creamy soap and the tea lotion. The Location: You can't beat the proximity to English Bay and an amazing assortment of little restaurants. So many cultures represented! We walked for a minute and were at English Bay which is really very pretty. Transit is right outside the front door. A Safeway grocery store is a few blocks away, well within walking distance. McDonalds is about the same. Stanley Park is mere minutes away by car, as is Lion's Gate Bridge which takes you to Grouse Mountain. Stanley Park: What a lovely park. HUGE drawback is the fee for parking ANYWHERE in the park at ANY time. It isn't overly expensive but it's a fee nonetheless. During the winter you shouldn't count on horse-draw tours or the mini train, naturally, but in nice weather you can still get a nice walk or relaxing bench meditation in. Plenty of people jogging and walking around the lovely waterfront. All in all it was a decent hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JonatasMello
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from jan-12 to jan-19 / 2012. The hotel is Very clean, in an excellent location near Stanley Park and downtown. The staff at the front desk were very helpful. There are many restaurants, grocery stores, supermarkets (Safeways and Nofrills) around. All in all a nice hotel, great location, nice rooms, nice staff, good food and good value!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: aer197
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights as a stopover to look around Vancouver. Good location near Stanley park and English Bay. Very helpful and polite staff. I liked the shops and restaurants in the local streets. Easy to use the buses to get about (or walk). I'd stay here again if I return.

Reviews.Title: “clean comfy and dog friendly”
Reviews.Author: ZLI
Reviews.Content: My husband and I never really consider any other hotel in Vancouver any more. The rooms are spotless, our poodle is welcomed with goodie bags and bags to take on our walks. Stanley Park and the beach are right out the front door. Yes, there is some street noise but please remember you are housed in the middle of a city of 2 million people...there will be noise in any hotel with windows. We love the fact that Ralph at the front desk always remembers us by name and is so helpful and charming. You can tell a well run place when good employees stay. We lived in Vancouver for many years, but retired to the country about 100 KM and two ferry rides away, so this affordable, comfy little hotel has become our home away from home whenever we need to come to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location, Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: jamesfalkener
Reviews.Content: Well appointed hotel right on English bay in Vancouver's west end, just next door to Stanley Park. Close enough to the business part of the city but located in the restaurant and shopping areas of the west end. Very nice restaurant at the hotel and numerous other restaurants just a few steps from the lobby. Public transit right outside the front door. Very pleasant staff. Well worth a return visit. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best Best Westen Ever”
Reviews.Author: Jim801
Reviews.Content: The furnishings, bed and bedding, amenities were the best I have ever experienced at a Best Western! I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer P
Reviews.Content: My travelling companion and I booked this in the internet using booking.com so knew nothing about it except what we read in customer feedback (which was very good). We asked for a room with a view and that is what we got - looking out over English Bay; beautiful. The staff we excellent - the room was not quite ready but they were ready with suggestions on how to fill our time until it was (the restaurant - for traditional Canadian pancakes - was a top tip). The trolley bus stop outside the door made access to downtown so easy. Around the corner are a great selection of restaurants, bars and cafes. Stanley Park is within walking distance, as are ferries to Granville Island and other points. Excellent staff, well-appointed room and excellent location. Definitely one for a repeat visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value /Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DeltaBoy3
Reviews.Content: You won't find better value or a better location. I've been a staying here 2-3 times a year for the last few years. Its very close to downtown but far enough away from all the noise so you can sleep well and you can't beat the location next door to English Bay and world-famous Stanley Park. It was recently upgraded to a "Plus" category by Best Western and the rooms have big flat-screen TVs, comfortable beds, nicely decorated rooms etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: trishaSanDiego
Reviews.Content: It was clean and pleasant. The bar downstairs had good food. Staff was friendly and helpful. The location was pretty nice. It was within easy walking distance to many restaurants and to the waterfront. Parking was available for a small additional charge. Overall a pretty good stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Stones Throw to English Bay Beach”
Reviews.Author: Amy W
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the West End of Vancouver. No frills but if you book quite far in advance you can get a room for good value. There is a bar downstairs and another called the Bayside just a few steps away. It's good for staying somewhere close to Stanley Park and English Bay Beach. What this hotel is not is romantic, trying to woo someone.. keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “English Bay”
Reviews.Author: MikeEgan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the edge of English Bay and Stanley Park. It is an very good hotel and reasonably priced. There are numerous excellent restaurants in the neighbourhood - check out Rain City Grill - and there is even a bicycle rental shop across the street close to all the bike trails along the waterfront. Downtown is a 15 minute walk, or take the bus outside the hotel door. You really can't go wrong at the Sands. Lates visit was in November, 2011, but we and friends have stayed many times there amd it has always been clean, efficient and well staffed.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Tom K
Reviews.Content: We stayed two lots of 3 nights at the Sands in September 2011 and were very happy. The staff at the front desk could not have been more helpful. When we left for one night in Seattle we were able to keep our bags at the hotel. Rooms and bathrooms were clean, air-conditioning, fridge, coffee machine all worked well. Only minor criticism was that the free wi-fi was a bit unreliable. I sometimes had to take the laptop down the corridor close to the lifts to get connected. Location was handy. Close to English Bay and Stanley Park. Buses to downtown and the hop-on-hop-off bus stops were close.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Jo_Qc
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, in October, between two flights. It is very easy to get to the hotel from the airport using public transportation (Skytrain and local bus). The room was OK, large enough, clean and with a comfortable bed. There was wifi in the room. The hotel lounge, Bayside Lounge, has an excellent view of the Bay. It's the ideal place for a drink before dinner. The hotel is very well located, close to the ocean and to Stanley Park. We had a nice long walk before dinner. There are plenty of restaurants close by. We had dinner at Costa's on Denman Street. I think that it was recently opened. Good italian food and service at a reasonable price. We had breakfast at the hotel. Service was very efficient and pleasant. Breakfast was good. We would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AC_15_GM
Reviews.Content: Great location, 100yards if that from water front and stanly park. Had room on front nice and spacious as light sleeper could have benifited from double glazing but view compensates. Free wi fi was very fast and great plus for work trip. Staff were friendly and willing to help with all aspects. Would recommend for location, service and price just needs bit work reduce outside noise.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at this hotel and it won't be my last”
Reviews.Author: MissMollyToronto
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver 2 years ago and stayed at this hotel because it was close to the sea wall and Stanley Park, and because of all the nearby restaurants, grocery stores etc. I came back again this year for the same reasons, and more importantly because of the price. They have made some upgrades to the rooms, primarily to flat screen TVs and coffee makers that use coffee pods...I actually prefer the old coffee makers and Blenz coffee but the TV was an upgrade. The location of this hotel is perfect, the bus stops right outside the door and the other one is right across the street. I took the skytrain from the airport and the C23 to the hotel, you can't beat it for $2.50 and it's a quick ride. There are fantastic and diverse restaurants all over this area and unlike the comments by another reviewer, I didn't feel scared at all, the area is well lit and there isn't much difference in street people in this area compared to other major cities. Some of them talked to me and I to them while waiting for the bus, no big deal even if one guy offered me a swig out of his rum bottle! Point is, if you spend so much time looking for things to complain about you aren't going to enjoy yourself. I rented a bike and pedaled around Stanley Park. Every morning when the sun came up I took a walk along the sea wall past second beach. It's so nice to wake up and be so close to such beautiful places. I also walked to Vanier Park and Granville Island 3 times while I was there, to Kitsilano twice, and on one day we took the Sea Bus over to North Vancouver and went to Lynn Canyon. On my last day in Vancouver I checked out but left my luggage at the hotel for a few hours. My friend and I asked if we could keep the umbrellas for the day and they said "absolutely". I thought that was very nice of them. I didn't have a car this time but the rate is very reasonable so when I come next time, I'll likely rent a car for a day or two.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but sadly poorly-maintained room”
Reviews.Author: cameraclaire
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights in early October. I got the room #520 and it was a spacious room with a big balcony, a new flat TV which was nice, a nice-sized desk and an extraordinarily comfortable bed. The location of the hotel was perfect and it was also the reason I chose this hotel because I wanted to be close to English Bay. This was the 2nd time I stayed in in Vancouver and last time was 10 years ago and I stayed at the YH (hostel) on Burnaby Street so staying in this hotel was surely an upgrade to me. Sadly, however, I was pretty disappointed with the room in terms of its level of cleanliness. The bathroom looked very old and the bathtub (I 100% recommend!) needed to be replaced. Several spots of the bathtub paint were scratched and the drain at the bottom (the silver thing) was basically broken. There were stains on the shower curtain. Both the sofa and the carpet looked like they needed a thorough cleaning. The 2nd day I dropped an empty water bottle (trash) on the floor by accident in the morning and after I returned to the hotel in the evening the bottle was still on the floor! What's more surprising to me was that the bottle was never picked up during the whole time I stayed there. I know housekeepers are not supposed to move customer's items too much when cleaning, but an empty water bottle on the floor? Don't get me wrong, the housekeepers all seemed friendly when I met them in the hallway. I was just confused why no one even wanted/cared to pick the trash up when they cleaned my room every day and it was certainly not a good service I expected. One night I was using eraser when writing my journal so there were some eraser bits on the floor afterwards. The next day after coming back to the room from a long day city tour, I found the eraser bits were still all over the floor. I was really surprised and actually a little bit upset. Shouldn't someone vacuum or do something to clean it? Those eraser bits were very visible so there was no way that the housekeepers "couldn't see it." I truly hope the hotel management will be willing to invest some money to make the hotel nicer. This hotel is in such a great location, the room was a good size, the view from balcony was delighting, and the bed was very comfortable (big plus!!). It's a pity that the room itself was poorly-maintained and the housekeepers didn't pay enough attention to their work. I also think it was a bit too expensive for a room with such a poor level of cleanliness. I will certainly want to go back though if the problems above can be solved. By the way, the front desk was professional. There were some Asian front desk agents who looked like they were on working holiday or something but they were actually the "friendlier" ones. There were some homeless outside the hotel at night, just like other reviewers said, and while it did make me a little bit nervous, I wouldn't call it bad or dangerous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: k8brit
Reviews.Content: He stayed at this property, for a weekend trip to Vancouver and most of all I have to say the location is fabulous!!! Right on English Bay and steps away from the beach and tons of great restaurants! It is also within walking distance to Stanley Park. If you want peace and quiet look elsewhere, while we enjoyed a waterfront view from our room, the street is quite busy and loud, we had to shut our windows before going to sleep. The front desk staff were also really great!!! and this pet friendly property gets bonus points for providing a doggie goodie bag for our pooch Jake upon arrival! This hotel is somewhat somewhat dated and needs a fair bit of modernizing and a little TLC, for example the bathroom had a pink tub with old taps that leaked a bit and the wallpaper and paint was peeling in spots of the room. BUT it was very clean and had all the mod cons including a flat screen tv, so if you can put up with a few outdated details here and there this place is worth staying at. I would definitely choose this location again, next time we want to stay downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, close to great amenities and services”
Reviews.Author: Phi P
Reviews.Content: Although not close to the Skytrain stations, bus service is quite convenient for anyone staying at the Sands. Additionally, great restaurants, groceries, various services (pharmacies, bike rentals), Stanley Park, English Bay, False Creek are within walking distance. Service from hotel staff was great and some good coupons for Sands-owned eateries were provided at check-in time. I would recommend requesting a room on the north side of the complex (facing the alley) as the aforementioned buses tend to make a bit of noise that could disturb the light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the poor reviews”
Reviews.Author: BBLUMERSD
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel, good location, great and helpful front desk staff. Nice walk to ocean and Stanley Park. Close to many eating places. Restaurant and bar on location. Super helpful staff. Even the maids are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, just a little tired - great bed through!”
Reviews.Author: RicardoMartinez
Reviews.Content: Had a night here late SEP 2011. The location is great, just a stones throw to the water and park and the celebrated sea wall walk. The place feels more like a motel than a full blown hotel. She is a little tired around the edges, just a bit of a 70's vibe. We had a great room, top floor, good views down over the park and bay. Nice balcony to sit on as well. The bathroom was a bit on the small side. Still fixtures and fittings were OK but the whole hotel feels as though it could do with a refurb. Very helpful staff at check in, which was fast and efficient. I enjoyed the location as 10 minute walk up the hill you had the restaurants and cafes of Davie Street and plenty of dining options right around the corner. The gem of this hotel though is the swanky corner bar, which is this sci-fi circular set up, with sunken bar in the middle of the room and just fantastic views over the park and the bay. A DJ spins cool chill out tunes as the attentive staff mix cocktails. The Bayview Lounge I seem to recall. Non hotel guests frequent the bar, it looks like a popular spot for locals too. The hotel will likely provide you with a 2-4-1 voucher for a drink here. There are a few coffee shops around for breakfast including the (in)famous Canadian chain, Tim Horton's (do they actually serve coffee here? - whatever they call it, it doesnt taste anything like coffee!) Their bagels are OK and local friends have raved about their chilli). Overall, a nice experience at the BW Sands in Vancouver. I just can't shake the feeling that the property just feels like it could do with a makeover and a refurb. Others on Trip Advisor have mentioned the bus stop out the front of the hotel - which can be a bit noisy. Still, the rooms are well insulated, and the noise is only slightly annoying if you have the doors to the balcony wide open. Then again, I was on the top floor, so it may have been noisier on lower levels. If you are a light sleeper it could be an issue (did I mention the beds? Super comfy, memory foam toppers maybe?) Would I stay again? Perhaps. I did spend a few nights in the Sandman up the hill on Davie Street, which probably had the edge over the sands due to central location and apartment style rooms - with views from the highrise tower.

Reviews.Title: “Location Not Bad as I Thought”
Reviews.Author: MissHK2009
Reviews.Content: In the first place, I thought it's badly located, away from any skytrain station, away from Robson St or Granville St or waterfront where the actions are. But after staying for one night, I like this hotel and found it so convenient with good transportation and shops restaurants nearby. There is no need to choose a hotel at the central downtown indeed where the hotels are much more expensive. Coming from the airport, you can take a sky train to Yaletown station. There is a bus (no. C23? as I recall) outside the Yaletown station heading to Davie Street and the last stop is this hotel. Outside the hotel entrance, there are also terminals for buses nos. 5 and 6 running round the downtown area. What surprised me as well is that the neighbourhood is like a community, self contained, with supermarkets, quality restaurants of seafood and other cuisines. It's unlike the Granville/Robson St which I found disappointing for the shops or restaurants there are of no character, always to-go Pizza/sushi shops or food courts with few customers. Room clean, spacious, bed very comfy, TV screen large. Staff friendly and helpful. A free computer internet is available for 30 mins at the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: zygiella Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldn't have suited us better, the location was superb and ideal for exploring English Bay and the West End, including Stanley Park. All the staff were extremely helpful, polite and courteous, both during our stay and prior to it when they offered great advice for transport to and from Vancouver Airport which is about 30 minutes away by taxi. The Checkers Bar food, drinks and service was exceptional and the food was good value for money and very enjoyable, with a wide choice. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff at the Sands, and we were very impressed by the welcoming and friendly approach from everyone, no matter what time of day or night, or however busy they were. We booked a Twin Room at the back of the Hotel for two nights, either side of a trip to the Rockies, and both nights were very restful in clean, beautifully presented accommodation with plenty of space. The first overnight stay followed a long flight from the UK, and we were in bed and asleep by 7pm! The second overnight trip was in a different Twin Room, which was equally as nice as the first room. The bathrooms were well appointed, with really good showers, plenty of lovely towels, and were spotlessly clean. We were able to leave left luggage with the Reception staff at no charge, and this was really useful, and well organised. The whole Hotel was superbly clean, and well maintained, and we were very impressed with the entire experience. On both occasions we walked around the local area, including Stanley Park which is fantastic, and were impressed with the cleanliness of the City, and we felt very safe, even when walking back from a lovely Italian restaurant a good few blocks down Davie Street at night. We are two mature ladies, and had no worries whatsoever about being alone without our husbands in this Hotel or locality. We had read reviews of lots of hotels in Vancouver before booking the Best Western Plus Sands Hotel, and were really delighted with the choice we made. It couldn't have been more perfect, and we would recommend the Sands to anyone, including families, single ladies, lone travellers etc. We had read a few negative reviews about the Sands, thankfully they didn't put us off, and we cannot understand why anyone should have any complaints so our advice is to ignore any reviews which don't praise this lovely Hotel! A big thank you to all the staff at the Sands, you made our trip to Vancouver very enjoyable, and we would have no hesitation in booking to stay with you again.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay Just As Good”
Reviews.Author: spacedogfl
Reviews.Content: This review is severely overdue! I stayed at the Sands from 4/17/11-4/25/11 and my stay was every bit as enjoyable as the first. I booked through Priceline for this stay instead of booking through the BW site and had no issues when checking in or out. When entering or exiting the hotel, the front desk staff seemed to always make a point of speaking to not just my friend and I, but to anyone else in the lobby. Their friendliness and courtesy made approaching them for suggestions or even to just chat about the day easy. It is an older building so the rooms (at least the two I've been in) are small but well furnished. There is not enough I can say about the hotel's location. At the corner of Denman and Davie, it is a short walk to Stanley Park and with buses that stop in front of the hotel, it is easy to get to any other destination in the city. As far as the area, I never felt unsafe. There are a number of clubs at the opposite end of Davie that are open late (>1 mile away). I have walked alone (not that I recommend doing so) from them in the wee hours of the morning without fearing for my safety. For some of my visit I ventured out by myself and never worried about returning at night and being harassed. As for bars, I highly recommend the Bayside Lounge. Next door to the hotel proper, the service there is great as are the drinks...and you can charge back to the room ;) The highlight of my stay was seeing Sue. Though she did not remember my name, she remembered my visit from last year and that highly impressed me. To me she exemplifies what is right with the property: the personalized, not forced friendliness and service. Each server that passed took the time to check on me even though I may not have been at "their table." For the downtown area, I feel this hotel is a great value. Again, I say this is not a new hotel with bright, wide open spaces and new fixtures. It is an older hotel with it's own style and charm. While the service, location and value are top notch, do not expect five-star luxuries. For me, it falls in the category "base of operations," to use solely for sleeping when not out and about. I can't wait to return to Vancouver next year and I will definitely be booking this hotel for my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience of my life!”
Reviews.Author: birdieCalgary
Reviews.Content: We were scheduled to embark on a Celebrity cruise to Alaska and so we booked into the Best Westen Sands Plus hotel since it was close by. We definately did not feel safe! Driving down the street towards the hotel was quite a scary experience with homeless people, drunks, drug additcts, transvestites etc walking up and down the street and all over the road. When we arrived we were expected to pay an extra $16 for parking. The parking was in an outdoor area with aboslutely no security at all. Through out the night when my husband looked out the window he could see people peering into the vehicles in the parking lot looking for things to steal. We ended having to take everything out of our vehicle and we were worried that the vehicle might not be there in the morning. Not a secure feeling! The elevator needed a room key to operate which was good but it was just inside a wide open area where street people could come in at any opportunity. The room was horrific!! The bathroom had broken tiles and a pink bathtub from the 70's. The faucets were rusty and disguisting! The shower head was a small white plastic hose that gave out barely enough water to get wet. The airconditioner was the cheap kind that was placed in a window and didn't work at all. My husband managed to wedge our suitcases against the door in such a fashion that we felt that if someone tried to come into our room during the night we would hear them. Not exactly what you would expect for over $250 per night!! Probably the worst part was that a few weeks later when we were home from our vacation my husband received an email from the manager asking him to rate his experience at the hotel. When he responded with our honest opinion the manger emailed him back and said he would only agree with the fact that the airconditioner didn't work and was going to disregard all our other comments. My husband then responded to the manager that if he didn't want an honest response he shouldn't have asked!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Layla07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night last week. We found ourselves in Vancouver a night early so walked in and Paulette on reception was so friendly and helpful in getting us a beautiful room for the night. We overlooked the street but could see the water from our room which was lovely. The room itself was great and couldn't fault the location. The only shame with the room was the water pressure in the shower- I had to lay down in the bath to wash my hair on the end. We went to the hotels bar checkers on the first night and it was very busy with karaoke going on and was great for an evening. We also had breakfast there the next morning and it was excellent. Jackie was very friendly and helpful and great to give tips on where to go! Overall greet night!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hek1122
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Sands is located within walking distance from Stanley Park--a great place to go to swim, run, or walk. While we were in Vancouver, we also used the Big Bus, and a stop was just down the street. It was really convenient. The room was beautiful, the beds were comfortable, and I truly loved the pillows! We had an ocean view room on the 5th floor. It was a bit noisy because we were right above a bus stop, but we had the fan on the air conditioning turned to high and everyone slept just fine. The air conditioning worked it's hardest, but wasn't able to keep the room as cool as we would have liked. And the shower controls reminded me of my grandma's bathroom that was last updated in the '50s. I couldn't get that hot/cold mix just right. Other than those two tiny things, we loved the hotel. The housekeeping staff was really friendly. The front desk staff was helpful. And the food and staff in the restaurant was great. We would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location near Stanley Pasrk”
Reviews.Author: Luke-11_46
Reviews.Content: Great location near Stanley Park trolley. Place was terrific except for the drunks outside making too much noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: KarenMarieK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the end of lively Davie Street, near the water. The very clean room came with a charmingly complicated coffee maker, lovely toiletries and a balcony overlooking the bustling downtown neighborhood. Also fun to look out and see all the people in the building across the way looking back at us. I see some of the reviews are down on the noise outside from the buses and the revelers--get a room in the back of the hotel if you're a country mouse or you just need the quiet. City folk and those that can sleep through anything will be happy to be in the front rooms. There is a lively bar/resto in the lobby. The parking lot is smallish. Nice staff.This is my new go to hotel when visiting the niece at UBC.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: OrangeWindies
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights here and my only complaints would be the noise from the air-conditioner and from the street outside. Vancouver's trolley buses make annoying beeping noises every time they stop and start, but that's not really the hotel's fault. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was spotless and the free wireless internet worked reliably. I especially liked the fact that the hotel had its own coin laundry, just what you need after a few days camping. It's very close to Stanley Park and there's an amazing selection of places to eat and drink nearby along Denman and Davie.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: cent1nu11
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a two nights' stay from a discount on-line. From the photos and the reviews I was very concerned about the accommodation (shabby looking outside photos) the noise from the street (bus stop right in front of the hotel). When I checked in, I was pleasantly surprised by the inside. I looked like it was recently renovated. The staff was very pleasant and professional. Our room was on the 4th floor facing the back parking lot. I didn't even notice the noise from the street. Our suite was clean but rather cramped. The parking is in the back and in the evening, they were filled up because of the shows in the lounge. We couldn't find parking in the lot, but the staff said that we could park next to the drop off area. The best thing going for it, is its location. One block from the hotel is beautiful Stanley Park. There are plenty of great eateries just around the corner (very trendy and cool). The price was very reasonable and we had breakfast coupons from Travelzoo. You do have to pay for parking though. Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel! Great staff, location and room!”
Reviews.Author: GeraldtonSteve
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the fifth floor overlooking Davie Street. Balcony and view of English Bay was absolutely stunning. The vibe of the neighborhood is friendly and fun. Hotel staff were exceptional in all regards, from the front desk to the restaurant, (which, as other reviews point out, isn't bad at all!). Staff knew everything about local attractions and in some cases, were able to give deals for them, (i.e. hop-on/hop-off bus). I would stay in this hotel again in a heartbeat and definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: simply9
Reviews.Content: The Vancouver part of our journey was towards the end of a 3 week adventure. I had heard a lot about Vancouver and it certainly lived up to my expectations. The hotel was fairly basic, small size room and I did have some problems working out how to use the air conditioning. That siad, the bed was comfortable and facing out on to Davie Street, might have expected more noise than there was. The staff were brilliant, both at reception and in the bar/restaurant. This was the best service that we received in Canada, they couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. Vancouver was agreat experinece and I wish that we had spent more time there as there is so much to do. Did whale watching from Steveton, visited Vancouver Island and Buschart Gardens - amazing!!, Grouse Mountain, the Hop on/off buses, Stanley Park, Gas Town, it just goes on and on. We will be back one day and this hotel is potentially our base.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: knowlc099
Reviews.Content: We had the hardest time picking where to stay in Vancouver and we finally decided on the Sands. It was a good choice. The room was great. We were on the 5th floor overlooking Davie street. It was a bit noisy, but nothing we couldn't handle. The beds were comfy, loved the pillows, the decor was very nice and I loved the complimentary amenities. The front desk staff was great, very friendly, very helpful. The restaurant was prompt and yummy and the staff was very nice. The air conditioner wasn't great, and I had the hardest time getting the water in the shower right. But overall, we would stay here again. It's in a great location within walking distance to Stanley Park, as well as to a Big Bus stop. Thanks for everything!

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: Grimy G
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated near the beach and Stanley Park. Rooms were comfortable, spacious and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The bus stop is in front of the hotel. Good restaurants are nearby. Certainly recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “So close to the beach!”
Reviews.Author: Fraumutter
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in Vancouver recently with our 2 older children. We requested a room toward the back as other reviewers had suggested. That was likely good advice, but our room was right over the kitchen fan, which was also noisy. The air conditioning unit in our suite rattled very loudly, but the fan only was tolerable. Thankfully the weather was not too hot so just the fan was okay for the night. The bonus was that it covered any potential hotel noises. We heard nothing from the hallway or other room. Beds were comfortable. Room was spacious and larger than most rooms with 2 queen beds in comparable hotels. My children loved that! The highlight was truly location! A number of little eateries right outside the door, as well as the beach with kayak rentals, swimming area, and entrance to Stanley Park. Any downtown attractions were easy to get to. Staff was friendly and helpful, especially Ralph. He patiently answered questioned and offered practical and helpful advice regarding parking, public transportation prices, best deals, best way to get to Granville Island, etc. Breakfast was tasty, but the same every day - their special off the menu: 2 fried eggs, one choice of 3 meats, hash-browns, 2 slices of toast/bread - choice of 4 kinds and a beverage. Though the building seems old, it has been renovated, is clean, neat, and in a great location! Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the noise that comes with the view....”
Reviews.Author: eddybabs
Reviews.Content: If you choose this hotel be aware... All rooms facing West or the Ocean are subject to the incessant beeps, motor hums, and "air brake" release noises created on both sides of the street ( Davie) in front of the hotel generated by the everpesent army of city buses that are parked throughout the day and night at the the terminus of the lines. Too bad the electric buses trade-off air polution for incredible noise polution that is only escaped by cranking up your room air conditioner to max - and even then. How ironic - white noise to escape noise. Never mind enjoying the sounds of the beach or the fresh air. If you stay here insist on an East facing room. No view - but you may enjoy your stay more. The hotel is a little dated but clean and very well situated in the heart of the action near the beach and Stanley Park. The staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, super location near by the sea.”
Reviews.Author: FlorienTexel
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, super location near by the sea and the bus to Robsonstreet in front of the hotel. Good restaurants in de neaby and Stanley Park around the corner! Good service.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneDon
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and tidy, The staff were helpfull, The location was great, the quet and of davie street and opposite Englisg Bay. The beds are softer than I am used to but ok. Certainly recommend this as a place to stay. Buses right outside are handy too.

Reviews.Title: “Very good however...”
Reviews.Author: Bouvier053
Reviews.Content: My wife and recently stayed at the Sands over the August long weekend. Much has been said by other reviewers about the noise, thin walls etc however we didn't find that it was too bad at all considering it was the August long weekend, Pride Parade and Celebration of Light fireworks festival. The room was clean and the bed comfortable however if you are thinking of using a water glass in the room please wash it first before using it. We had heard that some hotels wash the glasses in the room with whatever rag they have. In our case we marked a glass to see if we were receiving sanitized glasses or ? Unfortunately, our glass appears to have been rinsed and replaced with a fresh paper cap - so keep an eye on this. Location was fantastic, service was good and overall we would go back to the Sands. Keep in mind that you may have to pay for parking which adds to the overall cost of the stay. We tried Checkers restaurant on two occasions and found it underwhelming and would not go back. Although service was good on day and not so good the second, the brunch special was not and was cold as the burners had gone out. When we went back for breakfast on August 1st, we were not permitted to purchase the breakfast special because it was a holiday? I don't like being gouged so would choose White Spot on Georgia Street or another spot for breakfast before going back to Checkers.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel near English Bay & Davie/Denman St.”
Reviews.Author: chimo5
Reviews.Content: An older hotel but in good shape, looks like it was recently renovated. We enjoyed our stay here. An excellent location in the English Bay area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: brmen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the August long weekend. The hotel is in an amazing location! I opted for the ocean view/balcony room which allowed me to see the fireworks display and would have been good for watching the Pride Parade. The room was in good condition and effectively dampened the street noise. The bed was comfortable and the tv was more than ample. Also, the price was quite reasonable, considering the events taking place during the weekend and the hotel's prime location for them. My only complaint about the room was that the shower/tub did not drain properly. Otherwise everything else was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service, beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: EDMONTONSANDY
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Best Western Sands and as always had a clean,quiet room. The beds are outfitted with new comfort top mattresses and the cleanest bedding and duvets we have ever seen. Staff are friendly, helpful and pleasant. We visit Vancouver several times a year and always stay at the Sands because of the location, staff and great service. I love the little touches like umbrellas and the newspaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy bed, but yucky second-hand smoke”
Reviews.Author: Uberscheduler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times because we love its central location at English Beach and the view of the bay offered from some of the rooms. Also, parking at this hotel is a great deal compared to many of the newer hotels over by the convention centre. That being said, this hotel shows its age. Soundproofing is non-existant, and the clunky balcony doors offered us no protection from our neighbours who were ignoring the non-smoking rules and lighting up night and day. The air flow sent most of their smoke through the cracks in our patio doors and it was as if they were climbing into bed with us to light up! The bed, however, was VERY comfortable, as good or better than the "comfort beds" in more expensive hotels, and to be fair the front desk staff wanted to help us with the smokers but couldn't without catching them red-handed. If this hotel is still there the next time we visit Vancouver (can't help thinking it's going to get torn down for condos one of these days!), we'll stay there again, but we'll ask for a 4th floor ocean-view room, hopefully high up enough to dull the roar of the bus stop below but not fitted with balconies that encourage smokers to break the rules.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommendable”
Reviews.Author: ulla60essen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Best Western Sands by the Sea twice - for one night at the end of June before we started on our trip through British Columbia and for 3 nights at the end of July when we returned from our trip. We can highly recommend the hotel. It is only 3 minutes to the sea and Stanley Park, there is a bus stop in front of the hotel so that you can easily go anywhere you like. The rooms are nice and clean, the beds are very comfortable. The staff is extremely friendly, polite and helpful. We can also recommend the restaurant. We had breakfast there every morning and also dinner on the first night. There is another restaurant (only a three-minute-walk) "The Boathouse, which one should try.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...staff to match!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderluster069
Reviews.Content: The Sands is our favorite hotel in Vancouver. It has the best location on English Bay and nice rooms with views of the ocean. The best part is the staff...they are always so welcoming and we stay here because of them. It feels like home!

Reviews.Title: “What a hidden secret!!”
Reviews.Author: Metalleaf
Reviews.Content: An excellent place for my family. The beach, restaurants, convenience and grocery store is just a stroll away from the hotel. All the staff are the friendliest we've ever met. I recommend this hotel to all my family and friends. We are used to the noise, it's normal city noise.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: Barbara44926
Reviews.Content: Personnel were helpful and friendly. They did their best to serve everyone promptly. Location is wonderful. Within walking distance of good restaurants, the shore, and Stanley Park. Transportation readily available.

Reviews.Title: “Secret Gem”
Reviews.Author: Mersay
Reviews.Content: 7 friends booked this hotel for 2 days prior to our cruise to Alaska. This was such a nice, clean, hotel located across from Stanley Park and English Bay. Checkers Restaurant and Bayside Lounge were "attached" to the hotel, which made it so convenient to grab a bite to eat after site-seeing all day, or relaxing with a nice cocktail in the evening. The staff at Best Western was extremely helpful and even helped one lady in our group change travel araingements home.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location! New favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: solsearch
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here. Very helpful and friendly staff. I told them it was a special anniversary and they upgraded us to the top floor. Beautiful view of English Bay from our balcony. We ate every meal at Checkers restaurant. I found the prices reasonable, service was excellent. Plus they gave out several 2 for 1 food and drink vouchers. We enjoyed a couple of long walks along the sea wall, very enjoyable great views. We noticed many bar and grills in the area, some with outdoor seating facing the water. We cant wait to go back and explore some more! We usually stay at the other end of downtown but I think found found our new favorite spot!

Reviews.Title: “We rerally liked the staff”
Reviews.Author: NSpear
Reviews.Content: Although we were bothered by outsude noise on Saturday night, the staff's helpfulness more than made up for that. Best staff I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for tourists and good quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: Ajoz
Reviews.Content: A fine place to stay on vacation, close to many restaurants, the beach and Stanley Park. On the bus route to get into the downtown area for the better shopping otherwise a 15-20 min walk. We had a large and clean room facing away from the road, but bathroom quite small. Very friendly staff at reception and the restaurant, and the hotel let us check out late (2 pm) with no extra charge. Entry foyer a little dated and dark but overall a good place to stay and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: GretnaBhoy
Reviews.Content: Thee hotel is fine and good value for money. The room was comfortable and clean, only negative was the shower teemperature was a bit variable. As it was our first impression of Vancouver and Canada, what made it was the very friendly and helpful staff. Would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Dryhen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on Davie Street, a two minute walk from English Bay, where you can sit by the water and watch the sun go down. Not a big hotel, but clean and comfortable. Staff very helpful. Great juice bar opposite and individual restaurants close by. Walk along the bay and take a ferry to Granville Island to wander round the open market, full of local produce and craft shops. The hotel is a taxi ride from the airport which cost CAD38 and took about 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “really good intro to vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Distant_Scott
Reviews.Content: After getting off a 14 hour light I was greeted warmly. After reading some average reviews I was worried bout getting a road side room. The room was clean and well presented. No issues with bus noise at all. I even stayed the night of a canucks hockey game and of course there was a little noise after a great win but if you want pure silence dont stay in an international city centre. Staff were very helpful, great location to English bay and Stanley park. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: misty075
Reviews.Content: we needed a hotel the night before our cruise. some folks were concerned because this hotel is not near the port. Since we had an entire day in Vancouver ,we loved that it was near English Bay and Stanley Park, as well as places to eat and shop. The room was clean and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LITTLE HOTEL WITH CONVENIENT BUS SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: SoReCa
Reviews.Content: Small but comfortable hotel. Not a new hotel with tons of amenities, but well-appointed and clean. Yes, the walls are somewhat thin, so bring earplugs or ask for a room on a higher level on the back side. So convenient for public transport...buses pick up and drop off right in front (which accounts for some of the noise). Hotel staff are so friendly and helpful. Free community computer use or free wifi. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: mstenberg
Reviews.Content: Unfriendly check in staff, run down lobby, half renovated rooms and thin walls combined with NOISY cleaning staff who start at 6 am. Forget trying to get some sleep. If the maids don't wake you up, the pot smoke in the hallway might.

Reviews.Title: “One night was not enough”
Reviews.Author: Mary Lykes
Reviews.Content: Great location close to Stanley Park and public transit. Downtown was not too far away. It is an older hotel and the room was smallish but the location and price made me very very forgiving. Friendly and very efficient staff. I used Priceline for a good deal and would be happy to stay at the BW Sands again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Leisure10
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel for a one week stay during a trip out west to visit our son and sightsee based on tripadvisor reviews as well as price and location and was not disappointed. The location is great, just a few minutes away from Stanley Park and the beach. Cherry blossom trees and rhododendrons were beautiful this time of year. The hotel is very clean and comfortable, housekeeping does a great job there. Double King Room exactly as shown in hotel pictures. We were facing the street on the second floor and had no noise problem whatsoever. Stayed on Granville St. the last time we were in Vancouver and was much noisier there from the nightclubs but did not have that issue this time at all. We had a couple of meals at Checkers Restaurant which were very good and reasonably priced, also enjoyed the karaokee one night. Some of the locals who got up were pretty good. Tim Hortons right across the street is a bonus, also Starbucks next door. Would definitely stay there again if back in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: jockboyo
Reviews.Content: Arriving in the hotel the staff were helpful and pleasant. The room was spotlessly clean and a good size, the bathroom again was spotlessly clean. Parking is available but is limited we got the last space on the first night although every other time there were plenty of spaces. Just over the road is english bay which is the start of the sea wall around stanley park, (one of the must sees before you die). The housekeeping staff are very helpful and will make the room up when it suits you. The bus route to downtown starts and ends right outside the hotel, this is a little noisy if you leave the window open but makes getting around the city very easy. You need your key card to operate the elevator from the lobby which is good for security. Highly recommended friendly hotel in a prime location.

Reviews.Title: “One of the quietest hotel stays i ever had..”
Reviews.Author: johnnietravels
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel just for one night while in transit on vacation. I arrived late and just wanted a good sleep. I was not disappointed, I asked for and got a room at the back with a very comfortable king size bed. The staff member was the same at checkin and check out at the front desk and he was very pleasant. I think the front of the hotel can be noisey with buses etc, but the back worked for me. Rooms been renovated in recent years and are very comfortable. I heard no one in the hallway all night which is unusual, so hotel was likely not very busy this night. Hotel has a very good recycling program as well. I will stay here again, very nice property. Next time I will stay longer and enjoy the location more than I had time for. Again it's much quieter at the back, no view but more restful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Luz79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hop, skip and jump away from the English Bay. Everything you need is in walking distance around the hotel. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and provide a map of the area. There breakfast in the hotel is great, too. A good deal during the week for $5.99 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: tineadam1017
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Best Western Sands for three nights, after coming over from Europe. Although we specifically requested a quiet room before (being tipped of by tripadvisor), we were not so lucky. We ended up having a room to the street, which was really noisy: till late at night, a bus stopped regularly in front of our room, making a lot of noise (a.o. from the pneumatic valve). What is more, between 11 and 12 pm a car alarm went of four times. Next day, we asked to have a room to the back and got it. On the third evening, we saw a bunch of teenagers going out. Unfortunately, they came back around 10 pm and went to their rooms, which happened to be on our floor. They partied all through the night, with regular trips to the ice machine. They even knocked on our door. Although we asked the front desk to help, nothing happened. When we reported the hell of a night to the front desk next morning, they actually said to know of nothing! They couldn't find any complaint made at night. When we asked to be compensated for our hell of a night, we got 10% (!!) discount for this third night. All in all, don't go there, don't pay money which isn't worth it, and spread the word.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Cally86
Reviews.Content: This was the first english speaking hotel I've stayed in for a long time and it was my first trip to Canada so I had no expectations what-so-ever but was pleasantly surprised. The room was nice, clean, had everything I needed and was lovely and big. For me it was nice and quiet and was never bothered by other people staying in surrounding rooms etc. The staff were lovely in particular the guy who helped me extend my stay and checked me out when I left was lovely and always helpful. The cleaning staff were also very pleasant when we crossed paths and did a good job. I would stay here again as it fitted perfectly into everything I needed for my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at this hotel many times- would not hesitate to stay again”
Reviews.Author: Paletrees
Reviews.Content: I've been visiting Vancouver since 2008, and staying at this hotel since 2009. Such an amazing location, right beside the ocean, and central to so many other amenities. Traveling by transit is so much easier having two main routes stop right outside the door. Incredible staff, especially the housekeeping folks- the fact that one on my floor (Isabella, I think her name was) actually remembered me personally, even though I hadn't stayed there in a year, made me feel especially at home. The room was clean as always, the TV had recently been upgraded, and the bathroom was spotless as well. The room was a Bay view, so it was really nice to wake up and see the ocean. But that also meant dealing with the noise from the busy street below. It didn't bother me too much though, since i'm a pretty heavy sleeper. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel for people who are looking for a good value, but exceptional amenities, really friendly service, and awesome location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: snoopy647
Reviews.Content: Loved the location down at English Bay. We spent 2 nights and had a room facing the water with wonderful views. We are light sleepers and were not disturbed by any noise even though our room fronted Davie Street. When we arrived and checked in to our room (with a King size bed), we found there was water on the bathroom floor due to a leak in the toilet. We were moved promptly and although they were unable to find us another view room with a king size bed, we were given another lovely room with a queen and a hidabed. The couch was very comfy to relax on. I have attached pictures of both rooms. Although there is not breakfast included, they had a very reasonable breakfast in the restaurant downstairs. There is also a Tim Hortons directly across the streeet. We were going to a hockey game and took a bus and did not have to transfer. The bus stop was not even a 1/2 block away and we were dropped right at Rogers Arena. Very handy. We had a nice 1/2 hr walk to Pacific Centre earlier in the day. This is the first time we have not stayed at a hotel within a couple of blocks to Rogers Arena. We really enjoyed the change being right down at the water. The WIFI worked well in the room and they even provide bath robes and an umbrella. When we checked in they provided 2 for 1 coupons for a appetizer, drink and dessert. We used them all!!! Front desk staff, servers in the restaurant/bar and cleaning staff friendly and always had a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value but could do with thicker walls”
Reviews.Author: brizzeyAustralia
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights in a King room.The room was great very comfortable and nicely furnished .The room was always spotless and the staff at the front desk and Checkers restaurant were brilliant nothing a problem and willing to give any tourist advice needed. Checkers restaurant food was great and a good breakfast deal in the mornings . The location is excellent within walking distance of almost anywhere and its Fantastic value for your buck. My only problem was that the walls can be a little thin .I had a couple next door one night and could hear them however all other nights rooms next to me were free i think as I did not hear anything else. Theres free high speed wireless in the rooms and hotel too that worked very well

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly comfortable, budget priced little hotel close to the beach and downtown”
Reviews.Author: ZLI
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spotlessly clean and recently redecorated, if a little small. High end tv's and linens make your stay comfortable. Staff are friendly and helpful. Newspapers are provided every day. Parking is safe and well patrolled. The hotel is located close to the centre of the city, yet just half a block from the beach. Pets are welcome. Smoking is not. The hotel is excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful front desk staff - will do anything to make your stay more enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: slowfoodiegirl
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this hotel for a few days per month for the past 5 months and now feel like this is our second home. The location is great - walk out the front door to catch a bus downtown, walk along the seashore, check out the little restaurants and shops on Denman St. Walking into the hotel lobby is like stepping back in time, to the late 60's I'd guess. It's not fancy but it's functional. And the 6 ft teddy bear in the RCMP uniform adds to the decor! As long as you don't get noisy neighbours, it's usually quiet. There's street noise on one side, the other side is quieter except for those garbage trucks!! The heating and air conditioning are also from the 60's, I think, so it takes a bit getting used to, in order to get the right temperature. It would have been helpful for me to know that the heat comes ON during the night so I could have turned the thermostat off. The restaurant and bar are cosy, down home style and it has the most amazing smoked salmon appetizer (actually is almost meal size!). Make sure to go to the Bayshore Lounge, upstairs in the next building and sit in the round navy vinyl booths - you could imaging Dean Martin singing there!! It's reasonably priced so don't expect 5 star furnishings. What they do have is comfortable and clean. We love it!!

Reviews.Title: “How Can Anyone Complain???”
Reviews.Author: PersianPrinceUK
Reviews.Content: Ok i have read all the reviews and to be honest I dont understand how anyone can complain! I mean of course there are things that I will prefer in other hotels but isnt that what makes hotels unique?? This is not a 5 star hotel and for what I paid i had a very good deal and excellent value for money. I did alot of home work and my gf who lives in Vancouver visited all the hotels that i shortlisted and this was chosen by her and for sure she made the right choice. First of all the location is the best, it is conveniently located and walking distance to whatever you like! The staff are amazing and were very friendly and those of you who had bad exp i guess you must have had issues yourself since i met nearly everyone that worked in the hotel and everyone always had a smile and we very nice and friendly. The bar is good downstairs....... note i didnt say excellent! The food quality was good...... note i didnt say excellent but who cares when you have the best restaurants in town around the corner esspecially if you like sushi and japanese since there are plenty of choices! If you like chinese then you have to go Lins Kitchen on Broadway West, Indian Fusion then East to East also on Broadway West and Japanese and Sushi there are a few good ones just on Deman Street around the corner! If you want to higher a car only use Enterprise they are the best in town..... If you want the best room in the hotel then make sure you have fifth floor, sea facing with a balcony otherwise dont complain since you have probably paid for a rear or lower ground room! This not the Ritz so if you want the Ritz then you shouldnt stay here! I guess thats about it.......... if you want more advice give me a buz fareedd@hotmail.com. Take Care Freddy x

Reviews.Title: “Top notch location”
Reviews.Author: roaming-wifi
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here in late June 2010 and paid a rate of $137US per night. The room was fine, except there was no fridge in the room. It cost extra to have parking and no breakfast was provided with the rate. The location was ace though; it was walking distance to the beach, Stanley Park, restaurants and shops. There’s a bike hire place across the street from the hotel and their rates were great. I’d have no problem recommending this hotel simply because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: westcoasterBCCanada
Reviews.Content: We had only one night, and we wanted to stay in Vancouver. Well we found a great place with a view of English Bay and a lovely view of the sunset! The welcome was great and the service excellent. We had a vintage Rolls Royce car and were allowed to park it close to the entrance to the hotel where it definitely received lots of attention. Lots of great restaurants close by on English Bay. Had breakfast at Checkers in hotel and service was fast and food very good. A little noisy on street with buses, and some late night revellers so take ear plugs, but room very nice and beds comfortable. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-Pet Friendly”
Reviews.Author: DeltaBoy3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to spend some time downtown. We chose the Sands as its a great location right across the street from the ocean at English Bay, only two blocks to Stanley Park and we got to bring our dog with us. After shopping all day we had a late dinner at the BaySide Lounge (part of the hotel). Dinner was great and a large portion too. As we sipped our drinks we watched the sun set on English Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Location”
Reviews.Author: Ellis40
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here and was impressed with the hotel. The area is very safe just a bit quirky to say the least! Rooms are excellent ant the front desk are very helpful. Whilst its not exactly on English Beech I am sure that some rooms have an excellent view of it and whilst I didn't it was only a 1 minute walk, the sunsets are amazing. I never used the parking but couldn't really see anything wrong with it. Yes it's outside but like I said it's a safe area.

Reviews.Title: “good value for location”
Reviews.Author: blueridgesoon
Reviews.Content: Moved here from another (nice) hotel to be closer to fireworks competition. Great decision. Room recently redecorated and very pleasant; could barely hear any street noise and there was plenty. Terrific location to do anything on waterfront or go to Stanley Park. Due to event crowds, hard to find place to eat so went to restaurant on premise. Pleasant pub like setting, good food, ample portions at very reasonable price - would eat there again. A number of other eating choices within easy walk. Prefer staying here over other locations in Vancouver b/c you can take long walks along water and see all the big ships. Great for families who want to swim and play on beach. Bus stop outside door.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: quaint
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel we stayed in on our trip through West-Canada. We should have picked a better place to end the trip. + Location is very good. Very close to the sea, the center and Stanley Park. - Overnight parking on a non-secured parking costs 15 CAD for paying guests. This should be free. - The staff at the reception was not friendly and not interested. - The room can use a good make-over. Furniture was out dated. - The room is very noisy. It was hard to get to sleep due a loud airconditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: HybridGeorge
Reviews.Content: My wife, teenaged daughter and I booked a room at the Best Western Sands by the sea thru an online service. We chose it by its close location to English Bay beach (only 2 blocks) and Stanley Park. The photos available online made it look much better than it actually is. On arrival, we were somewhat dismayed to find the hotel almost in front of a very busy city bus stop, with pedestrian traffic so heavy we just about couldn't turn off the street into the hotel driveway. The lobby is quite small, and the front desk even smaller. The desk clerk was perfunctory, and spent more time warning us about the smoking prohibitions in the rooms than anything else. The hotel description said it was a non-smoking property, which was important to us since our daughter has asthma, so we were well-aware of the smoking prohibition already. Parking was an extra $13 a night, and parking consisted of a 2-deck open-air parkade that opened to a dingy alley in the rear. There was limited space available, so we had to park on the upper level, which had no elevator service, and we had to drag our suitcases down a dirty concrete stairwell to the lobby. Once in the lobby, we were informed that the elevator would require a room key card just to open the elevator door. Given the crush of street people outside, I could understand the need for this, but it raised immediate security concerns about our location and the safety of access to our car. The room we had booked was a suite, with a separate bedroom. It was nicely furnished, even had an efficiency-apartment style kitchen, but there was almost too much furniture in each room. The bedroom had 2 double beds that just about filled the room. The hotel website said that the rooms were air-conditioned, but that turned out to be a window air conditioner in each room, mounted almost on the floor, with curtains that couldn't be moved out of the way of the AC. We ended up just opening the windows and wishing for a breeze, as there were no ceiling fans or any way to circulate air. The windows looked out on the dingy alley and the upper deck of the parking structure, so there was not much of a view. On the plus side, the bedroom did have a large, flat screen TV, and the beds were comfortable. When we asked the front desk person where the work-out room was, he had no idea the hotel even had one, even though the hotel's website said they had one.. If it's there, we could not locate it. Parking was a big concern, because it was first-come, first-served, and if a guest arrived too late to find a space, you were out $13 for nothing. Upper deck was not well-lighted, so safety was an issue. For the price of the hotel, I was really disappointed. It's not well-maintained, and the crush of street people right outside the lobby door day and night made it uncomfortable and not secure, whether we were on foot or trying to get the car out of the parking structure. I had expected the neighborhood to be more upscale, given the hotel location and price, but we felt like we were in the middle of a questionable area of town. I wished I could have gotten out of the booking once I saw the hotel and its surroundings, but could not, since I booked online and nothing was refundable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff...lovely hotel...great beds...super location...the Best!”
Reviews.Author: teshss
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the hotel staff greeted us with a very friendly, knowledgeable attitude...they quickly pulled our reservation and within minutes we were checked in with little perks to make us feel welcome. The room was clean and had a very welcoming feel. This is by far the 'Best' of the Best Western hotels that I have ever stayed in. The atmosphere, the layout, the location, were all superb...and the staff all went the extra mile. You felt valued and important... As it should be, but is often forgotten..."Customer is King...and in this hotel they treat you accordingly"...a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Bit tired, but good location”
Reviews.Author: Sadgit_Dave
Reviews.Content: No real grumbles. Yeah parts of the hotel are in need of a renovation, but it's far from run down. Rooms at the front (sea view, yeah right) can be noisey as it's on a busy road. Rooms at the back of the hotel (mountain view, just about) are quieter. Downtown is not cheap, and this hotel is a good option. As it's on a busy street the bus service is great. It's also very close to Stanley park and the beaches of English bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Onchaneers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the start of our road trip around western Canada. We'd booked online well in advance and got a good deal (3 nights for the price of 2). It was a great hotel right by English Bay in the West End of Vancouver. Professional reception staff, convenient parking ($10 per day), spacious room at the front with a good view of English Bay. Lots of places to eat close by - including Greek & Italian. A good mix of formal and informal establishments. Checkers restaurant and bar is attached to the hotel and we ate their our first night and had the breakfast specials there on two mornings. Good value and nice food. We hired bicycles for an afternoon from the shop opposite the hotel (next to a Tim Horton's). Hire shop staff were very helpful and riding the bikes around Stanley Park was one of the most fun things ever! We walked to Canada Place - only took about half an hour. Would definately recommend this hotel for its location, qualty and price. It was one of the best hotels of the 12 we stayed in on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bouncyjan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, the location was ideal, next to English Bay and Stanley Park. The rooms were a good size with large, comfy beds. Staff were excellent. We ate breakfast and in the evening once each at Checkers Bar and Grill (attached to hotel), which was good and also the Bayside Lounge (next door) which had a great view, great martinis and good food - you get discount vouchers for both places when you check in. There is a computer in reception where you can use the Internet for free. Good value, good location and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: silverfox1964
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were at the Best Western Sands, Vancouver, from June 2 to June 7 and had a great time. But I would be remiss if I didn't single out your front desk staff for outstanding service. Everyone at the desk, am/pm staff were excellent. They helped with sightseeing information, restaurants, and most especially, with offering me assistance with a medical problem by recommending doctor and pharmacy information. All were intelligent and very pleasant. Congratulations to all involved and to their supervisor. Bob Rizzotti USA

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, well located accommodation”
Reviews.Author: trixiesh
Reviews.Content: Good clean accommodation with plenty of room amenities. Great updated bathroom. Close to nice beach, transport, food outlets, Stanley Park and bus transport outside. Can walk into the city along the coastline walk if you are fit. Rooms on road side could be noisy but I opted for the other side which was better. I recommend for a few days pre-cruising or whatever.

Reviews.Title: “What an absolute pleasure”
Reviews.Author: jac0bsky
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at the hotel but spent many hours there in touch with the hotel manager Eddy and Food and beverage/banquet manager Greg. I organized the stay and meals for 50 relatives and friends from all over North America who stayed there from 2-5 nights. We also had a Saturday night party and Sunday morning brunch at the sands. I have nothing to say except to convey my utmost highest regards for all the staff and everyone with whom I came into contact. Both Eddy and Greg are fabulous and absolute pleasures to work with. All other staff were kind, patient, friendly and helpful. I immediately liked the hotel the first time I walked in, and found it cozy, comfy, and with a wonderful friendly and informal ambience.
