It's in a marvelous location in Vancouver- at the intersection of Davie and Denman streets in the west end, adjacent to downtown. Although I did not sleep at the hotel, I saw several of the rooms, and they were immaculate and looked very comfortable. All of our friends and relatives loved staying there and were very happy with their accomodations and the meals we had. Unbelievably reasonable for the quality and the amount of food.. My daughter and I (who live in Vancouver) were in and out and around the hotel for 5 days or so; we were really "homesick" for it when the festivities of our event were over and guests were gone. Wonderful hotel, fabulous staff, beautiful rooms, great location, delicious food, happily pet friendly...A pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter1958
Reviews.Content: We stayed here without pre booking and were not dissapointed. The rate we felt was slightly high but was justified by the location. A stones throw from the ocean and surrounded by terrific restaurants. Parking didnt seem as sucure as some other places we have stayed at but nothing happened and we were assured that there security would be on top of things anyway. There were no incidents. Over all a very nice place and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: RBRN
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern, clean & comfortable. It is a short distance from Downtown shops, Stanley Park and many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Third Visit, just as good as the first 2.”
Reviews.Author: missjennymarie
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay with the BW Sands By the Sea. The hotel is great. Comfortable and clean rooms. Quick check in and out service and no problems with the bill. The restaurant is pub-style, affordable and quality. Somewhat limited choices with the menu but there is certainly something for everyone. I would only suggest asking for an ocean view room. A better view than the 'mountain view.' It is the perfect location. Very close to English Bay and there are many excellent restaurants near by, within walking distance. (Check out 'Cupcakes' on Denman!!!) The prices are reasonable and the staff are efficient and friendly. They are also accommodating to requests for things like calling for cabs etc. Great service and value. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: spacedogfl
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for three nights and enjoyed my stay. It's well situated on English Bay: Stanley Park and ferry transportation to Granville Island are both a short walk away. Additionally, downtown bus routes stop in front of, or near the hotel. Robson Street is only a few blocks away, and in between are a number of great establishments. The room I stayed in seemed a bit cramped, a double bed in a room that would have been better served with a twin; but, the free wireless, adjacent restaurant and cozy lounge balanced that. Each day, the front desk staff was helpful with suggestions and directions for sightseeing for this first-time visitor. The only issue I had was that I did not receive a wake-up call the morning of my departure. Fortunately, I'm paranoid about oversleeping, so I had set the room alarm, as well as my watch and travel alarm. Overall, I would say this hotel is a great value for its location, and I will gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located, decent value, right by English Bay and Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: almostoldguysrule
Reviews.Content: Most hotels in downtown Vancouver are in the core. This one is located by English Bay, one of the most beautiful urban beach spots in the world that I've witnessed, very close to Stanley Park. Try walking the Seawall, which courses around Stanley Park and downtown, including by the Olympic flame site. You can walk everywhere. But bring ood walking shoes! The hotel has a convenient drive-in feature, is one of two that I know of by English Bay, offers decent rates, and is comfortable enough. There are no views to speak of. It has a homey restaurant adjacent and a Starbucks nearby. The Raincity Grill, an absolutely excellent restaurant, is kitty corner.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great staff, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Hammyclaire
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I spent 5 nights at this Best Western and had a wonderful time. We were able to check in early, were offered sea view/balcony upgrades at very low prices (although we didn't take them) and the staff were very friendly. The room was very big with a handy fridge and lots of storage. The room itself was a little tired looking (mainly just the windows and paint that could be refreshed) but still very comfortable, the rest of the hotel (corridors, lobby, fitness room etc.) were of a very high standard. Staff can't do enough for you, they helped us print future airplane tickets for free, gave travel advice when going to Paralympic events, posted mail for us etc. The bar is a great place to relax in and is a favourite with locals - you get a number of vouchers from the hotel to spend there. As for location you can't beat it - right by the beach and surrounded by great value restaurants/cafes. Would stay there again when in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaGardener
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just fine for our hospital trip: clean, fabulous location near the sea wall walks where we walked on English Bay down to Second Beach in Stanley Park and to the Lagoon. It's just off Denman where there are lots of places to eat. We traveled with the dog, so were glad of friendly and helpful staff. Also, we were able to order in from Chuckles next door where the hotel had given us several two for one certificates. The chowder was outstanding, even better than the one I make! Desserts were generous and the apple crumble was very good especially.

Reviews.Title: “Much Improved From Last Stay”
Reviews.Author: rjc260
Reviews.Content: I reviewed the Best Western Sands about a year and a half ago and gave it average marks. We recently stayed here as we received an outstanding rate on Priceline. We saw a noticeable difference from our last stay as the rooms have been nicely renovated. The rooms are now nicely appointed (and are fairly spacious). The bathroom was small but sufficient. Our room faced the alley once again but given that it was winter we had the door shut so noise wasn't an issue. The television was standard and not an upgraded flat screen that many hotels are offering. The hotel location is great, right near the intersection of Davie & Denman and close to many restaurants & bars and steps away from the waterfront and Stanley Park. There is also a fun bar in the lobby. There is a fitness room but I have never taken a look. Parking is available in an adjacent lot for $10 per day. Check in was quick and efficient. Elevators are secure as a card key is required to use them. Overall we had a great stay at the Sands and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cortious and efficent”
Reviews.Author: cieling21
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the evening and the staff were quick and friendly with arranging a room for us

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: musictraveler29
Reviews.Content: Best Western Sands was a great place to stay - easy to find, great staff, great rooms and awesome breakfast. I would certainly send my team there again the next time we are in Vancouver. I always trust Best Western and this hotel is certainly up to par. Well done BW Sands!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad spot, not a bad hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tchochtke
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Vancouver with my parents for my convocation ceremony at UBC. I had lived in Vancouver for years, and wanted to make sure that I got a place down by English Bay, and I also needed someplace with parking. I had wandered through to the Sands when I had lived in the area, and it always seemed nice, so I thought what the heck, I'll book the room. First tip - always check online for the best price - and book online through best western's site... they won't request full payment, and for me, I ended up saving $50/night by cancelling my original reservation and rebooking it. We arrived on a rainy rainy Vancouver night - and I had requested a quiet room, so we weren't facing the water - but that was fine with me. What we didn't hear was the car traffic out front; what we DID hear was HORSE traffic out back! Apparently, as part of their regular 'beat' the police officers that are on horseback bring them into the underground parkade and they do some training exercises with the horses. SO every day, around 3pm, there are these horses clopping around out back! I thought it was funny, that I had travelled all the way from Calgary & 'cowboy country' and there were horses out back. Anyhew, the parking there was great - it was free, and there were a lot of spots that were fairly safe to leave a vehicle overnight. They have a limited in-room dining menu, but they have a great two restaurants in the hotel, and about a million restaurants within walking distance, so if one goes hungry it is their own fault. There wasn't a business centre per se, but they did have a computer that you could jump on and check your email for a slight fee - but I also believe they would have had free wireless internet if you had a computer with you. The greatest part of the stay, for me, was the service. My mother was unexpectedly sick when we were there, and part of what helps her stop being sick is cornstarch - it being late at night, we couldn't think of where we could go for cornstarch, but luckily the kitchen was open and they were so wonderful to help us out. The food at the bar "Checkers", while is more like pub food, is still not too shabby - but the service there, and throughout is pretty darn great. REcommendations when staying here - get out and go for a walk along English Bay, have dinner at the Boathouse around the corner, and try to be around at about 2pm in the afternoon to hang out with the horses. And, on the weeknights, have yourself abit of karaoke in the lounge.. a little cheesy, but it is rather fun.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff/great location.”
Reviews.Author: LYNNEEngland
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this hotel! The staff were friendly, cheerful and very helpful. The location was great - close to Stanley Park and the beach. My husband's in a wheelchair so the walk along the seawall was a real plus. We were based at the hotel for 4 weeks in their adapted disabled room. The maids looked after us very well. We loved eating in the Checkers Bar where the menu was varied and the food excellent. The Bar staff were always cheerful and ready to chat. The Reception staff were very helpful with directions and bookings. We would really recommend this wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Ohagikko
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for almost 3 years, and I am very impressed with the quality of service provided by the front desk staff. Jeff is very knowledgeble about city information, when I asked him for directions/bus info, he had the answers to everything without searching for it. Eddy, has always been very friendly and helpful. and other staff at the desk too, they always go extra and extra miles to make my stay very enjoyable. also the location is perfect, 30 seconds to the beach, around the hotel there are so many restaurants to choose from, so many stores for sweets, and 5 min away from Robson St too. my review might sound too perfect, but really, I never had a single complaint about this hotel... oh, not all the rooms have fridge, but that's about it. and again, the best thing about this hotel is wonderful staff. I would definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends and family, which most of them always stay there anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Disturbing Incident Involving Hotel Employee”
Reviews.Author: lets_be_honest2
Reviews.Content: We were in Vancouver to celebrate a local friend's birthday and rented two rooms in this hotel. One of our rooms was not available when we checked in, so we dropped our luggage off in one room, met up with our friends, and went for a walk up Davie Street. As we approached our hotel after our walk, we witnessed a very disturbing incident in front of the hotel by the driveway to their parking lot. One man (with his back to us, dressed all in black) was yelling at another man who appeared to be homeless. As we got closer to them, the man in black suddenly punched the other man in the jaw. This man dropped to the ground, clearly unconscious from the blow. The man in black then viciously kicked the unconscious man in the ribs. He was clearly angry and out of control. We all assumed this was some type of street brawl and hurried to enter into the safety of the hotel. As we walked past them, the man in black turned and we could see his Best Western hotel name badge on his chest. We all were shocked at this display of violence. This hotel employee was NOT defending himself. The other man did not attempt to hit the employee. Granted, we did not know what had happened prior to our arrival, but we did not observe any physical provocation from the other man. Needless to say, we all felt quite disturbed by this incident. We heard sirens and could see police and aid cars in front of the hotel from our rooms. I felt certain that this hotel employee should have been arrested for assault. You can imagine our shock and dismay when we crossed through the lobby a few hours later and saw this man standing behind the check in desk, chatting with the other employees! We will not stay at this hotel ever again because of this incident. The rooms were ok, but overpriced. We were a little put off by some kind of rodent or bug trap hidden behind the armoire. The bathroom was somewhat claustrophobic, the street noise was a little loud, but not as loud as the geriatric air conditioner. This is an old hotel which has been unsuccessfully camouflaged as a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with my stay”
Reviews.Author: MissMollyToronto
Reviews.Content: I selected Best Western Sands primarily because I had gift cards that I got when I redeemed air miles. BW was in my price range and the location was by English Bay, one of my favourite places. I wanted a room that was clean, had free wireless internet, a hair dryer and reasonable paid parking. I got all that I wanted and then some. The room was nice, a bit dated but very clean. The wireless internet was super quick and I had a hair dryer. As well, the room came equipped with an ironing board and iron, an umbrella, and a coffee maker. The coffee was from Blenz and was delicious. I was also lucky enough to have a mountain view and woke up to a beautiful sight every day. The area of the hotel is fantastic, I used the bus daily and Stanley Park/English Bay were right across the street. There were some really good restaurants in the area as well, so I had everything at my fingertips. Parking was $9.99 a night which was really reasonable. I will definitely stay there again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best view room 527,Sunsets were fabulous we did not want to leave.”
Reviews.Author: WestmeathMargaret
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 18 Days Best Western Sands,Loved the hotel, everything beside us English Bay, transport outside door,Stanley Park 6 minutes walk, Restaurants all around us, Staff in Sands were the friendliest we have ever met ,Yury thanks for all your help with all our Tours,Blake for maps and transport, Mercedes for keeping our room clean and tidy,and all staff Eddie, Will, Kylie, Guys you were simple the best. We hope to be back someday keep room 527. for us, what a view, we arrived as guests and left as friends, We loved Vancouver and would recommend hotel to family ,friends,Lovely big comfy Bed. Julia (Sally) William Reddin. Athlone, Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Rude bar manager ruined our stay! Fire him.”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug181
Reviews.Content: We were enjoying our stay until we went to the Sands Bayside Lounge for a nightcap. The bar was busy so we waited in line to be seated and were eventually led to a seat at the bar by the hostess and doorman. After sitting down, we were rudely told by the bar manager those seats were taken. He was still rude, even after we expalined we were told to sit there. And there was nobody around looking for those seats. We are so mad we dont ever want to go back despite the otherwise nice expereince. Fire this chump...he is losing you business. He is more qualified to be a prison guard than serving customers.

Reviews.Title: “Good BUT could be better”
Reviews.Author: gerrybrow
Reviews.Content: well were do i start, good location 200 meters from the beach,but in the centre of everything which is great IF the hotel had double glazing,which it does'nt,there is a bar on the ground floor which stays open until one,and then everyone has to get home,!!!! the buses run until 11,which is great if you are on them and they are electric which you would think no noise BUT air brakes and lift on them makes each one noisy and you could have up to 6 out side.THE HOTEL ,clean and tidy but in need of a up date,bath room old colours and very tired,air conditioning works but noisy,had a word with the staff on leaving about these items and told would bring it up at the next management meeting,yeh right..good views from the window at the front we were on the 2nd for our 1st 2 day stay then on the 4th on our 5 day stay so we do know a little about this hotel,check it out before you book and make sure its the one for you,but does the location cancelle out all the other problems only you can decide.staff okay very helpfull when we had problems to sort out...lots to do in Vancouver its a good walk to the city centre but the bus will take you there and it does as i say stop right outside the hotel ..have fun.............

Reviews.Title: “Location outweighs weaknesses”
Reviews.Author: Discovertude
Reviews.Content: We could not have picked a better location for our stay; the staff was outstandingly helpful and friendly. It's a hopping neighborhood with more restaurants than you can shake a stick at, and two-block access to the beach, Stanley Park, bay trails and more. Several aspects of the rooms are decrepit -- substandard AC, obvious gaps at tops of doors, little to no soundproofing -- but very clean and nice clean/modern touches in the bathroom, carpet, furnishings. When making reservations, ask to be AWAY from the 70-year-old ice machines. We were able to move to a quieter room -- not that it was quiet, but it was quieter and sleepable.

Reviews.Title: “The joys of this hotel passed us by”
Reviews.Author: Mr. MJB
Reviews.Content: Vancouver was the last stop for two nights on our fly drive through the Rockies before we went to Vancouver Island for a few days. Vancouver confused us. We started by disliking it but were won round by the time we left. Approaching from the East down Hastings Road we saw more vagrants than we have seen anywhere else in our travels. The traffic was bad caused by the closure of a main Street in the centre of town and this continued right down to our hotel , both the vagrancy, although reduced in scale and the traffic. However we did gain a much better impression after taking an evening dinner cruise around the harbour and other trips. The hotel reception was not very welcoming although the gentleman dealing with us did lighten up after a while and ended up being very helpful and friendly. Our rooms were very dismal. Other reviewers on this site speak very highly of the hotel and its accomodation - we must just have been unlucky. I suspect that as Gay Pride was taking place a couple of days after we left and there was also an international firework competition taking place, the hotel was fully booked and we and our friends were accomodated in rooms that were overdue for refurb and which with ordinary levels of occupation may not have been used. We observed other people at reception booking out as they were unhappy with their room and had made alternative arrangements. The room was shabby at best and the housekeeping was far from perfect. Our friends in an adjacent room did not walk barefoot on the carpet as they considered it to be too dirty and stained. The bedding and towels were clean and in good condition. There was air conditioning installed in one of the windows but it was noisy and rattled the other windows. A large square hole had been cut out of the blackout curtain so that cooled air could circulate into the room after dark ( so could bright sunshine in the morning!!). The bathroom was acceptable. Reception was inconsistent, some staff were very helpful others not. When we asked about getting to Capilano Bridge, one member of staff said "why would you want to, all you do is cross a bridge and then come back" We had a problem in making international phone calls. We followed the instructions but were unable to connect. We sought help from Reception who sent the head of house-keeping to show us how to use the phones. She had no success either. Upon explaining this to reception to see if we could use another phone we learned that we had been charged Can$4.25 for each attempt. However this was refunded upon protest. She then said that although the instructions stated that it was necessary to dial 9 for a line they had noticed that in some rooms it only worked if you dialed 8 - Bingo-it worked! Breakfast was included but what you had was not negotiable.Scrambled eggs, bacon, hash browns and toast with Tea or Coffee - take it or leave it. We also felt a little insecure in the area after dusk. English Beach is almost adjacent to the hotel. We decided to wander down to walk as the sun set. It was very busy and many people appeared to be 'spaced out' and again there was some vagrancy and begging. It was much more pleasant during the day. Once we explored Vancouver we were more happy. Recommend Capilano Bridge for a couple of hours. Quite expensive but well presented with good facilities and pleasant walks and raised boardwalks. Good attempts at providing educational/informative guidance to children. We also enjoyed the habour boat tour with dinner. Although reception tried to put us off this as well as we could eat in a top class retaurant for the price, the tour itself takes you to areas you would not see on a tour bus and there an informative commentary for part of the tour and a sing duo during dinner. Stanley Park too is great and we toured it by Tram. Would choose another hotel if we ever returned to Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Standard Best Western”
Reviews.Author: OregonianOregon
Reviews.Content: Clean, a little cramped, quiet on top floor, no view, good linen. Lots of places for breakfast within a half block. Parking lot a little tight but it worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: bttraveler13
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights then again for 1 night in June with my wife and teenage children (2 rooms), the rooms were clean and comfortable. Our rooms were relatively quiet, we were on the 4th floor then the 3rd floor and were there on weekends during both stays. The staff at the front desk were very helpful, we arrived early and they stored our bags till our rooms were ready. They were also very helpful with advice and directions. The location was fantastic, it's about 5 minutes walk to the beach at English bay , 10 -15 minutes to the edge of Stanley park. There were probably a dozen restaurants within 10 minutes of the hotel. Rain city grill has a take out window that sells fish and chips for 10 dollars which was very good, Nat's Pizza is about a 5-10 minutes walk away and was a hit with my kids

Reviews.Title: “Great location but....”
Reviews.Author: gallarus
Reviews.Content: Great location by beachfront with easy access to Stanley Park area and eating places on Denman St but as windows to street are only single glazed suggest you ask for a room to rear as it was noisy. We got caught with the extra taxes so the quoted C$150/night was actually C$176 at checkout!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingy Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: marylinn
Reviews.Content: My sweetheart and I decided to leave Seattle last minute and enjoy an unplanned Vancouver weekend. Generally we stay at high end, luxery hotels like the Fairmount. Upon arrival in the city we heard about the Marathon, crowded hotels and had some trip advisor lists on our laptop to choose from. We happened to drive in on the westside-saw the SANDS and decided to quickly grab one of the few rooms left-thinking we'd gotten a lower end Motel. It's not the Fairmount, but it was a wonderful, pleasureable & relaxing, stay. Everything said positively in the above reviews is true. The remodeled room was great, we loved the location and water view, and really had nice walks on the beach. We too, enjoyed Jeff's warm welcome and the price was super. I know we'll return to this little gem-and the lounge view of the water was also a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches!”
Reviews.Author: jenn_bowen
Reviews.Content: Well maybe I should change my title to "Roach!" because I only spotted the one cockroach in the bathroom. In any case, it was gross. The room was very clean and the bathroom looked updated. The rest of the room could have used some updating as well! Overall the value of the room was great, considering the location in downtown Vancouver, overlooking the English Bay and steps from Stanley Park. Nothing really stood out in the hotel/room, besides the view and location, basically it was a place to sleep after a night out sipping martinis! No complaints whatsoever, besides the roach, which cannot be helped in some cities! There is construction going on across the street and the hotel had supplied earplugs in the rooms, which we didn't even need... I don't remember hearing any construction (but we did stay Friday night, so maybe no work on Saturday morning?).

Reviews.Title: “Happy Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Tam78
Reviews.Content: We checked in and upgraded on arrival to a balcony room with no hassles. The staff were extremely helpful and willing to assist at all times during our stay. Our room was located on the top floor and overlooked English Bay. The room was clean and well kept. There was construction work going on across the road from the hotel and the only thing we can’t say is that the whole view we had will still be there after construction. The area around Davie Street is known for its gay community which made more sense to me when we arrived why the hotel advertised as gay friendly (I read gay as happy). The hotel is well located to many restaurants, grocery stores and Robson Street for shopping. Also within walking distance to Stanley Park. We hired some bikes and rode it. We also followed the bike trail and did a complete loop of Vancouver (False Creek). From Science World we negotiated our way across town to Gastown. The only downside was we ended up coming out at a part of West Hastings Street where there was a lot of derelicts and it was a little dirty and smelt like urine. Not a place I would want to be at night. Overall our stay was pleasant and most enjoyable. Would highly recommend this hotel and location to anyone travelling to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great time !”
Reviews.Author: dumaurier
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel in an excellent location in downtown Vancouver on English Bay. The lounge " Checkers" has an excellent and friendly service. The menu has everything you may want from a lounge menu at reasonable price. The other lounge has a terrific view of English Bay ! At the Front desk, who were greeted by a very attentive and helpful staff. The maid service was excellent. Our room was beautifully furnished, equipped with a fridge and a little balcony which we could not use as the snow was falling over Vancouver . Our bathroom was equipped with all amenities you may expect. All in all, a great little secret to share with your friends !

Reviews.Title: “Sincere cheerful service, very clean, great location...”
Reviews.Author: BicycleCanada
Reviews.Content: First timer to this hotel. Decided on it for location, as we wanted to be close to downtown, close to ocean, and close to Burrard St. bridge. Found hotel to be wonderful surprise when it came to all aspects. Great location for starters, being easy to find and access, and close to good restaurants and shops. Jeff, the front desk agent, was warm, friendly, and very personable. (Always welcome characteristics of service providers.) The chambermaid I shared elevator with was also smiling, chatty and friendly. Room was very clean, and it was very quiet over the parking lot. Ample parking too. My husband and I and our two tall sons fit fine in the double queen room, and the shower, TV and wifi were all in good working order. Definitely good value for money, and we'll stay there again for our next bi-monthly visit to the big city.

Reviews.Title: “A great value”
Reviews.Author: BBinCT
Reviews.Content: First of all, you have to understand that this is not a new hotel. It is however an older hotel that has been nicely redone, except that the bathroom could be updated. The room we stayed was very clean, decent size with a nice bed and a somewhat limited (fourth floor) view of English Bay. Our biggest complaint was the heating/cooling system - needs to be worked on. There is on-site parking at a daily $8.99 charge that is well worth the price. The hotel is steps away from the beautiful Stanley Park, close to downtown, minutes from Granville Park and in the midst of scores of ethnic and local restaurants. The staff is more than accommodating, going above and beyond to satisfy. We had a front room that was a bit noisy due to daytime construction and buses at night but we slept well. All in all, we felt that this hotel was a very good value!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pip442
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sands for 5 nights from 30 Aug 08 pre cruise, and then for 1 night on 18th Sept before returning to the UK, and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is in an excellent location just a minutes walk from the beach at English Bay and 15 minutes walk from Stanley Park. Its only about a 15 minute bus ride into the City Centre and Gastown from the bus stop outside the Hotel entrance. The Staff were terrific - very friendly and helpful, even when we arrived back too early for checking in on the 18th they took care of our luggage whilst we enjoyed the local amenities. Although its not the most modern of hotels around, it was clean and comfortable and the food in Checkers was very good. We would like to return to Vancouver in the future and will have no hesitation in booking the Sands.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: gunner60
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our holiday after staying 8 nights in the hotel. We have nothing but praise for the hotel. We found the staff friendly and helpful. Our rooms, even though the decor was dated, we found them to be very clean with no evidence of bed bugs. As previously stated in previous reviews, the location was perfect, with stunning sunsets at night. There was a good bar/ restaurant attached to the hotel, and within a very short distance was plenty of eating and drinking places. We would definately come back to vancouver and would definately stay in the hotel again. We found plenty to do in the 9 days. Vancouver is certainly a lovely place with extremely friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs by the Sea”
Reviews.Author: Sakander
Reviews.Content: Checked into hotel on Sept. 11th, 2008. Beginning my annual 2-3 week stay (vacation time from work in Asia). Long time patron of hotel. Was admitted to Vancouver General Hospital Emergency on Sept. 21st with over 200 bed bug bites (head to toe.......took picutres it was so remarkable). Told by hotel there would be only minimum compensation and no personal apology from the owner/general manager (known to me for years). Only a "half off" offer on room charge. Had to pay for the week I was bitten to pieces is seems. I was a long term patron (almost 20 years) and for the past 6 years I had been staying for 2-3 weeks in a row as part of my annual vacation from work in Asia (hotel is right next to parents home in English Bay). Owner/General Manager wouldn't even meet with me directly, despite having declared me "guest of the month" and inviting me to staff Christmas parites on past stays. Even had personal greeting cards from him, welcoming me back to the hotel. What a boot licking hypocrite. It's a dishonorable bed bug and flea trap now. Turned into a backpackers, low end tours, sawdust joint. Dissheveled rustics trekking in and out with their filthy pets. Rooms only superficially cleaned. And now infested with pet fleas and bed bugs. DON'T STAY THERE!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to other great reviews”
Reviews.Author: yayaya123
Reviews.Content: I had selected a few hotels to check out for a stay in Vancouver, I looked up TripAdvisor and read the reviews on 'The Sands'. I must agree with all the positives about this hotel. We were staying for 2 nights in Vancouver then touring the Rockies and coming back to Vancouver for 3 nights, we stayed in 'The Sands' again even though we had meant to try a different location on our return. The staff were so helpful and friendly, the rooms were spotless and the restaurant gave us breakfast way later than normal without any fuss. Vancouver is a great city and 'The Sands' certainly added to our enjoyment of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StanleyParkFan
Reviews.Content: Going from Vancouver on an Alskan cruise so decided to add on a few nights in Vancouver before hand staying at the Best Western Sands - and how glad we were that we did. Hotel location was great - right on English Beach, and the surrounding area felt safe and had a great selection of bars and restaurants. Hotel bar itself was good and seemed very popular. Had a sea view room which was clean, spacious and very comfortable. All the hotel staff were kind and curteous, especially those on reception

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: caljoy
Reviews.Content: We were in Vancouver for 3 nights. Had a hard time finding 2 hotel rooms on the weekend. The Sands had 2 rooms. We were very pleased. Yes, it is expensive and like the other reviewer said, "Vancouver is expensive, get over it!" Our room was roomy and we appreciated the sink outside of the bathroom. We saw no bedbugs and the maids cleaned up the room everyday and changed the sheets. We thought that having a room overlooking the parking lot ended up being so much quieter than the street side, even though there was no view. BUT it is the location that is so great. Like everyone stated, literally steps from the great beach at English Bay and we walked the entire sea wall around Stanley park starting from our hotel. It would have been much longer if we had started from a hotel closer to the "downtown" area. There is a Starbucks on the corner and every conceivable restaurant you could want and many dessert stores and pubs too. We never felt unsafe in this area at all. Our weather was nice, high 70's so people were out and this area can be a little crowded with people, but it also makes for interesting people watching. All in all we thought it was a find. Not a high end place, but a clean, safe, friendly hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: rsh12345
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel thruogh fligh centre travel agent. Good location, stayed three nights. Bed linen did not look as if it had been changed from previous guest. First morning woke with itches and red bites from bed bugs. Noticed another report similar from an earlier guest.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous location at English Bay”
Reviews.Author: Chris&Carole
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of a Canadian Affair package part of which was 3 days in Vancouver. The hotel room was very clean and tidy and very comfortable for a budget - tourist hotel. Facilities were good - restaurant and bar for evening meals and breakfast offered a comprehensive menu which was not a la carte but very substantial. Service in the hotel and restaurant was very good, staff were friendly and attentive. The over-riding benefit of this hotel is its location in English Bay, close to Stanley Park and a short bus or taxi ride to downtown. We felt we had been lucky to stay in this area as so much was going on. I would much prefer English Bay to a city centre location - the sunsets were amazing, the locals friendly and polite and all the young people were a credit to Vancouver - just enjoying themselves without any trouble, swearing or drunkedness - what a treat for Brits!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: joshkspa
Reviews.Content: We walked in that day looking for something along Davie Street. We were quoted $199 (I knew prices would be high being peak of tourism) The room was clean but the air conditioner barely worked. We were hot all night long. The front desk staff were rude from the time we check in until the time we left. This is a stripped down very basic hotel, needs a makeover. There is no ice machine on our floor so we were told either go up or down a level to get ice. Kind of annoying but again not a big deal. For $200 down the street our friends got a MUCH nicer "posh" place with great views. I would have been ok with this place for maybe $100 but definitely not 200. I won't stay here again, mainly because of how rude the people were when we mentioned the air conditioner--they were robotic, unapologetic and seemed annoyed from the minute we checked in until the second we left.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel in a superb location.”
Reviews.Author: draig_cymru
Reviews.Content: First things first - Vancouver is an expensive place to stay. I travelled with two friends as a group of 3 guys in their late 20's and stayed in the city for 3 nights before embarking on a Canadian road trip from West to East. It was extremely difficult finding both a hotel which suited our budget and one that had decent reviews on Trip Advisor. (I will only stay at places that average a score of 4/5 ). The Sands by the Sea solved our problem and we were very glad we stayed there having passed a few of the hotels in the same price bracket in the city which looked pretty run down. The Lobby, Restaurant/Cafe and Bar were tidy and service was excellent. The room was average - nothing to write home about, but equally nothing to complain about. We had a room at the rear of the hotel looking the car park so it wasn't interesting, but it was quiet. The surrounding location was lovely. 1 minute away from the Western facing English Bay beach which meant a stunning sunset every night, 2-3 minutes away from Stanley park, and it was about 5 minutes from the top end of Robson street, 15 minutes from the harbour area so certainly not a huge walk away from the hotel areas charging 3 or 4 times the amount we paid. Very vibrant area, no seediness about it that I've read can be the case near some of the other hotels in the price bracket. Plenty of bar/grills where you can get good food and have a drink at sunset and a huge variety of international cuisine available on the same street. Personally I like being able to drink and dine close to a hotel I'm staying at when I stay in a City and the area was both full of choice and felt safe. The best way of putting it (which the three of us agreed on) is that we'd get away with bringing our girlfriends here! Decent rooms, excellent and safe nightlife and not too much walking!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Rooms Need Major Renovating”
Reviews.Author: CACAtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sands in late June. First of all, the best thing about the Sands is the location. It's a block from English Bay and an easy walk to Stanley Park. Many of the fun activities (walking, biking, kayaking) in Vancouver couldn't be closer. Also, the neighborhood has a wide assortment of cafes and restaurants that should appeal to everyone. Now the downside of staying at the Sands. The property isn't aging well. The rooms need serious work. I encountered numerous problems in my room (i.e. the bathroom fan didn't work, the water in the shower alternated between very hot and very cold, the knob for the air conditioner came off in my hand.) Clearly, the management has done very little to keep up the place, and it shows. But for the location, I would give the Sands two stars. The rooms are just not in good shape. If you're not prepared to rough it a bit with worn rooms, the Sands isn't the place for you. On the other hand, if you're willing to put up with an older facility that needs some work, the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gscal99
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. I was visiting in order to race the Triathlon World Championships, so comfort was very important. Eddie gave me a great rate and Mr. Grant made sure I had oatmeal for breakfast on race day. All of the staff were so very helpful. The rooms were clean and quiet (except for the construction across the street). And my room had a partial ocean view. The hotel is right in center of all of the beach activities. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this property to others. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for conference attendee”
Reviews.Author: EJW8191
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to attend Institute of Industrial Engineers conference in the Westin Bayside hotel (15-20 minutes walk away, and more expensive). Overall experience very good. Room large, clean, comfortable bed, quiet (I was on 3rd floor overlooking parking lot, I never did bother to wheedle for room with nicer view, since I was hardly in room except to eat or sleep). Notwithstanding other reviews, I did not feel bathroom was too small. Since room has small refrigerator, I was able to save money by buying food at nearby supermarket on Denman Street. Therefore, I did not try the hotel restaurant. Free access to internet in lobby (and with a printer, so I could print my boarding pass night before flying out). Certainly not a luxury hotel, but good value for money with no noticeable defects or downside. Desk service always excellent, attentive, friendly, and helpful. To get here from airport, take 424 bus to airport spur station, 98 bus north into town, get off at Davie Street stop, and take #6 bus west to Denman (when driver told me "Everyone off; route ends here," I was 30 feet from hotel lobby door). Bus fare $3.75. Walking distance to seaside with lovely view, post office, markets, Stanley Park, Vancouver Art Gallery, and Roedde House Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: MarianneVictoria
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sands for one night in early March prior to heading off on holiday. As always, I was more than satisfied with all aspects of the service but on the day I was leaving to catch my train the staff excelled themselves. I had a harmless but messy fall at English Bay and returned to the hotel with a jacket muddied from collar to hem. Although I had already checked out the housekeeper took the jacket, ran it through a wash cycle and returned it to me complete with coat hanger and covering plastic bag. The hotel staff refused payment and wished me a good holiday. I have stayed at the Sands several times over the years and always been happy but this experience demonstrated just how well guests are looked after. The Sands will be my hotel of choice whenever I am in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Best Western Sands By the Sea”
Reviews.Author: Jane1962
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home from a weekend stay at the Best Western Sands Hotel and cannot stop raving about what a top notch establishment it is. The staff are extremely friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. The hotel is very nicely decorated and appointed but not to the point where you can't relax. I had a lovely room with a King Sized bed and sitting area. I felt spoiled by the rich comforter, fluffy pillows and comfortable couch. I felt like a queen! The restaurant is excellent; the servers were warm and friendly and the food was superb! Checkers was fun at night; I had a great time singing Karaoke! The Bayside lounge was a nice place to sit, have a cool drink, an appetizer and enjoy the fantastic view of English Bay before going out to dinner. It was just a short walk to the beach at English Bay and the seawall to Stanley Park so I took the opportunity to go for an early morning run by myself to the Lions Gate Bridge and back. It was wonderful to be out running along the ocean breathing in the fresh sea air and the early morning rays. I look forward to returning for a visit in the summer so that I can enjoy the beach! As a single person travelling alone I am always concerned about my personal safety however everything about the hotel and the location was perfect. I was not afraid to walk or run on my own. The Sands Hotel is perfect for me, close to the beach, Stanley Park, world class restaurants and central to everything worth doing in Vancouver. I will stay at the Best Western Sands everytime that I am in Vancouver and would recommend this establishment to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “liked the stay but probably won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: crazygrey
Reviews.Content: I spend Christmas at the Best Western Sands for 4 nights. I got 2 queen beds in my room on the third floor with the ocean view. The room was clean and the service desk was helpful for directions. However, the room was too cold even though the heater was on, so I requested an extra heater which was provided for me free of charge. After 2 nights, there was a mouse in my room! Shocking, disturbing and disgusting. I called the service desk and requested a change of rooms. They moved me to a better room in the fifth floor with a balcony. The location is good since it is near the English Bay, but it is kinda far from the downtown area. If you don't want to drive, transportation by bus was convenient (2 buses going straight to downtown opposite to the hotel). Overall, I liked my experience at Best Western Sands but that mouse incident kinda ruined it for me. I wouldn't stay at the hotel because I would rather a closer hotel to the downtown area, but if you are looking for a hotel closer to the English Bay and Stanley park I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: windflower876
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel over the Thanksgiving weekend. The front desk staff were very professional, helpful, courteous, and pleasant. The king bed in the room was super! Except for my bed at home, I have not slept on such a comfortable bed. The only niggling little thing about the room is that the bathroom is very small. The location of this hotel is great -- near the water and city transit buses stop close to the entrance. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wachusk
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVED my time at Best Western. The front desk staff were so friendly and courteous. I was upgraded to a better room and it had an awesome view of the ocean. The rooms were recently renovated and beautiful! The hotel is very close to the ocean and tonnes of places to eat. Ill definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - outdated basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: Monwin
Reviews.Content: Recently had 3 individual stays at this hotel travelling between the Rockies & Vancouver Island. The staff were very nice and helpful - as all Canadians are. Going into the lift was a timewarp back to the 70's. Room was clean, but bathroom badly needed refurbishing. Good venue if you don't spend much time in your room and want to be near beach and Stanley park. The restaurants around the corner facing the sea were tops fro eating!

Reviews.Title: “Average, had some issues”
Reviews.Author: DJVera
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August, around the time of the Festival of Light. The hotel itself is in a brilliant position, practically overlooking English Bay and the room we stayed in was large, comfortable and not too noisy for one facing a road (Davie Street). However, a couple of things spoilt it for us. A few times during our stay I woke up in the morning with small red bite marks on my legs which itched constantly and took the rest of the holiday to go away. Also, when we went to check out after a week, the guy on the desk tried to overcharge us by over $100. Luckily I'd booked online and had printed out the confirmation page which I showed him. After lots of discussion and excuses the bill was changed to what I was expecting to pay. This hotel has its good points but I'm not sure I'd stay there again - and I'd definitely advise anyone who does to make sure they know exactly what their bill should come to!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Watch the Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: CanadaTraveller1
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel, the staff is very accomodating and the rooms/suites are very nice. We have nothing to say but good things about the hotel, cleanliness, service and accomodations. We did experience an interesting interaction with the restaurant associated with the hotel however. The evening staff are wonderful however the morning staff are not as service oriented. We went from the hotel to the restaurant for breakfast as they are in the same building and ordered breakfast, ate, received the bill, paid and on the way out of the building noticed a sign that stated breakfast was $4.95 not the $8.95 that we had paid, for the same meal. I returned to the restaurant thinking that there had been an error and was informed that if you don't specifically ask for the special you pay the full price. I stated that we had not been informed that there was a special on breakfast and that the meal was the same, I was told that they do not inform people of the special price. I spoke with the restaurant manager who stated the same. I found it interesting that if you enter the restaurant from the hotel you are not aware of the special and that only people entering from the street are given that information. We did however enjoy the evening Kareoke and the luncheon seafood chowder is the best. Needless to say we walked down Denman Street and found a lovely restaurant called the Grove Inn that offered wonderful meals at reasonable prices. The Grove Inn is packed with locals and tourists, the staff and meals are good. It is nothing special but worth the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful/welcoming/helpful/fun”
Reviews.Author: sillyb1
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Canada began in Vancouver at the Best Western Sands by the Sea Hotel. From the moment we walked into reception the service given was second to none. This holiday was our holiday of a lifetime and was made special by the wonderful people that we met, the service given and the food in the restaurant attached to the Hotel was second to none. OUr experience of your hotel was wonderful and something that we will treasure for the rest of our lives. Thanks again for making it so special Sylvia and Bob Taylor/Bunch

Reviews.Title: “In Need of an Update, But Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: StevieH
Reviews.Content: This was our introduction to Canada, so at the time we had nothing to compare it with. The staff were extraordinarily helpful and friendly, but as we found later, this is quite usual everywhere - anyone slightly less than friendly in Canada really stands out. The room was comfortable, but we had to ask for a move because of the smells from the Chinese restaurant next door. We understand the hotel is being refurbished, which is necessary. However, if they then charge higher prices, there is better value nearby. While we were there, the weather wasn't too hot, so we didn't need the air-con. The air-con seemed a bit primitive, mounted in the window, with a hole cut in the curtain and probably quite noisy. Location is good - near Stanley Park, but Davie Street is pretty ropey by Vancouver standards - a bit scruffy and lots of vagrants. Walking to Gas Town from here would probably be pushing it for most tourists. A good Safeway about 5 minutes' walk away provided all our needs very conveniently. The day we moved out and waiting for a taxi, a racoon nonchalantly wandered past the hotel entrance, but was gone before I had time to get my camera. Hotel staff were not surprised. A nice, if fairly basic hotel, but as we later discovered there is better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent - rigth across from English Bay and around the corner from famous Robson Street shopping and dining. The problem - only baseboard heating. No other heating/cooling system for air circulation or air conditioning. With the noise on the street, and below in the parking lot the only choice is to close your window and suffer through the heat. The review following is correct, the bathrooms need a complete remodeling.

Reviews.Title: “good spot for stanley park and beach”
Reviews.Author: hdriver
Reviews.Content: Had five nights here as a base to explore Vancouver Staff friendly. Had our room upgraded to sea view at no extra cost when the receptioist realised we were there for more than a couple of nights. Room big enough for three of us and was clean with plenty of storage space, although the bathroom looked a bit dated. The Checkers restaurant had good choice for breakfast and the evening meal we had there was good. Purchased an internet card from reception to catch up on the local football back home. There was a gym and sauna that was in a converted bedroom,which we didn't use. Would have liked to see a hot tub there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: snacks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western after finding dissapointment at another hotel in Downtown Vancouver. The rooms were clean and the staff helpful and welcome. The best thing about this hotel is that is in a great location in town for the beach and is only a short distance from stanley park. We found a great italian Romanos Bar and Grill which is only a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Do not be put off by the name, the resturant is set in what appears to be an old manor house surrounded by a pretty garden. Home made food and great service, well worth the short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Well located but often without a view...”
Reviews.Author: calvin-the-dog
Reviews.Content: This well considered hotel (Frommer’s, Guide du Routard, etc.) is indeed conveniently located close to the Stanley Park and the English Beach, often perceived as one of the best in Vancouver. Topography can not lye…This is indeed the case. But don’t the trust the mention “rooms with a view”… Unless you get a room in one of the upper floors, the English Bay view is far from being convincing. In the lower floors, your room is first facing huge building making a screen between you and the Beach. Of course, if you look on the right hand side of the street, at the end of the street, you will see the water and the beginning of Stanley Park. Let say: it is not a straightforward view…To be clear: to benefit from this “poor” view, you first had to ask for a “room with Bay view”, more expensive than the other ones… Should you have made the “cheap” choice, then, your view was just awkward: the hotel parking and a quite grim street! We just experienced the restaurant for the breakfast but it was not our best souvenir from Vancouver: the service was slow and the food quality was just “doable”… Rooms are OK albeit not that large if you want to accommodate more than 2 adults. Here as in most of the Best Western Hotels in North America, we enjoyed a quite valuable room service: the free Wi-Fi connection, great for all those who cannot afford to let the PC at home! In a nutshell, from a pure topographic point of view: great neighborhood, good location easy access to the “urban wilderness” of Vancouver, a lot of good restaurants in the same area, etc. but an overrated and expensive hotel as such. We presume there should be better choices not so far away from this spot…. Sorry no pictures because it's just not "picture worthy"...

Reviews.Title: “Nice little find.”
Reviews.Author: CTMillard
Reviews.Content: We were quite happy to find this hotel. Made a great jumping off point for our visit to Vancouver, loved that it was walking distance from Stanley Park! Would have preferred a slightly larger lobby, but our rooms were large, clean and airy. Wonderful, down-to-earth staff and service made our stay that much better -- thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Views of English Bay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Worried at first that the hotel was too far from downtown, but by day 2 loved the proximity to the beach, Stanley Park and the host of eateries along Denman St. It was nice to be able to return here after a day's sight seeing. Hotel staff were very friendly and changed our rooms to face the bay. Facilities were standard and clean, and the rooms comfortable. A thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dawn on holiday
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel the evening of the last night of the fireworks display in August which we had no idea about. We'd driven from the airport and all the roads were shut off and crowds heading towards the sea front. However, we made our way through the police blocks and were met by very helpful hotel staff. Jet lagged we made the way to our room and were delighted to find our balcony overlooked the seafront so we flopped on the sofa and enjoyed the display. I can thoroughly recommend this hotel. The staff were excellent both at reception and the breakfast room / restaurant. They enquired about our trips every day and helped out with hints. There is a computer for use in the lobby for e-mail and web access and you pay at Reception for a card. An excellent stay. Perfect location for sightseeing. You must hire a bike and cycle around Stanley Park - beautiful and take a trip up Grouse Mountain.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: convert94
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect location at foot of Davie street right around corner from Denman and across street from English Bay. Clean, large rooms, efficient service, attached cafe. Stayed in June 04 would stay again. Even walked from here all the way to the opposite end of town to IMAX theatre at Canada Place; tons of restaurants nearby. Only negative is $7 @ day fee to park; this seems like an extra rip-off, which it is but they get away with it cause parking is real tight in this part of town.
